    5135                 :            :     uint64      sysidentifier;
    5136                 :            :     char        mock_auth_nonce[MOCK_AUTH_NONCE_LEN];
    5137                 :            :     struct timeval tv;
    5138                 :            :     pg_crc32c   crc;
    5139                 :            : 
    5140                 :            :     /*
    5141                 :            :      * Select a hopefully-unique system identifier code for this installation.
    5142                 :            :      * We use the result of gettimeofday(), including the fractional seconds
    5143                 :            :      * field, as being about as unique as we can easily get.  (Think not to
    5144                 :            :      * use random(), since it hasn't been seeded and there's no portable way
    5145                 :            :      * to seed it other than the system clock value...)  The upper half of the
    5146                 :            :      * uint64 value is just the tv_sec part, while the lower half contains the
    5147                 :            :      * tv_usec part (which must fit in 20 bits), plus 12 bits from our current
    5148                 :            :      * PID for a little extra uniqueness.  A person knowing this encoding can
    5149                 :            :      * determine the initialization time of the installation, which could
    5150                 :            :      * perhaps be useful sometimes.
    5151                 :            :      */
    5152                 :          0 :     gettimeofday(&tv, NULL);
    5153                 :          0 :     sysidentifier = ((uint64) tv.tv_sec) << 32;
    5154                 :          0 :     sysidentifier |= ((uint64) tv.tv_usec) << 12;
    5155                 :          0 :     sysidentifier |= getpid() & 0xFFF;
    5156                 :            : 
    5157                 :            :     /*
    5158                 :            :      * Generate a random nonce. This is used for authentication requests that
    5159                 :            :      * will fail because the user does not exist. The nonce is used to create
    5160                 :            :      * a genuine-looking password challenge for the non-existent user, in lieu
    5161                 :            :      * of an actual stored password.
    5162                 :            :      */
    5163         [ #  # ]:          0 :     if (!pg_strong_random(mock_auth_nonce, MOCK_AUTH_NONCE_LEN))
    5164         [ #  # ]:          0 :         ereport(PANIC,
    5165                 :            :                 (errcode(ERRCODE_INTERNAL_ERROR),
    5166                 :            :                  errmsg("could not generate secret authorization token")));
    5167                 :            : 
    5168                 :            :     /* First timeline ID is always 1 */
    5169                 :          0 :     ThisTimeLineID = 1;
    5170                 :            : 
    5171                 :            :     /* page buffer must be aligned suitably for O_DIRECT */
    5172                 :          0 :     buffer = (char *) palloc(XLOG_BLCKSZ + XLOG_BLCKSZ);
    5173                 :          0 :     page = (XLogPageHeader) TYPEALIGN(XLOG_BLCKSZ, buffer);
    5174                 :          0 :     memset(page, 0, XLOG_BLCKSZ);
    5175                 :            : 
    5176                 :            :     /*
    5177                 :            :      * Set up information for the initial checkpoint record
    5178                 :            :      *
    5179                 :            :      * The initial checkpoint record is written to the beginning of the WAL
    5180                 :            :      * segment with logid=0 logseg=1. The very first WAL segment, 0/0, is not
    5181                 :            :      * used, so that we can use 0/0 to mean "before any valid WAL segment".
    5182                 :            :      */
    5183                 :          0 :     checkPoint.redo = wal_segment_size + SizeOfXLogLongPHD;
    5184                 :          0 :     checkPoint.ThisTimeLineID = ThisTimeLineID;
    5185                 :          0 :     checkPoint.PrevTimeLineID = ThisTimeLineID;
    5186                 :          0 :     checkPoint.fullPageWrites = fullPageWrites;
    5187                 :          0 :     checkPoint.nextFullXid =
    5188                 :            :         FullTransactionIdFromEpochAndXid(0, FirstNormalTransactionId);
    5189                 :          0 :     checkPoint.nextOid = FirstBootstrapObjectId;
    5190                 :          0 :     checkPoint.nextMulti = FirstMultiXactId;
    5191                 :          0 :     checkPoint.nextMultiOffset = 0;
    5192                 :          0 :     checkPoint.oldestXid = FirstNormalTransactionId;
    5193                 :          0 :     checkPoint.oldestXidDB = TemplateDbOid;
    5194                 :          0 :     checkPoint.oldestMulti = FirstMultiXactId;
    5195                 :          0 :     checkPoint.oldestMultiDB = TemplateDbOid;
    5196                 :          0 :     checkPoint.oldestCommitTsXid = InvalidTransactionId;
    5197                 :          0 :     checkPoint.newestCommitTsXid = InvalidTransactionId;
    5198                 :          0 :     checkPoint.time = (pg_time_t) time(NULL);
    5199                 :          0 :     checkPoint.oldestActiveXid = InvalidTransactionId;
    5200                 :            : 
    5201                 :          0 :     ShmemVariableCache->nextFullXid = checkPoint.nextFullXid;
    5202                 :          0 :     ShmemVariableCache->nextOid = checkPoint.nextOid;
    5203                 :          0 :     ShmemVariableCache->oidCount = 0;
    5204                 :          0 :     MultiXactSetNextMXact(checkPoint.nextMulti, checkPoint.nextMultiOffset);
    5205                 :          0 :     AdvanceOldestClogXid(checkPoint.oldestXid);
    5206                 :          0 :     SetTransactionIdLimit(checkPoint.oldestXid, checkPoint.oldestXidDB);
    5207                 :          0 :     SetMultiXactIdLimit(checkPoint.oldestMulti, checkPoint.oldestMultiDB, true);
    5208                 :          0 :     SetCommitTsLimit(InvalidTransactionId, InvalidTransactionId);
    5209                 :            : 
    5210                 :            :     /* Set up the XLOG page header */
    5211                 :          0 :     page->xlp_magic = XLOG_PAGE_MAGIC;
    5212                 :          0 :     page->xlp_info = XLP_LONG_HEADER;
    5213                 :          0 :     page->xlp_tli = ThisTimeLineID;
    5214                 :          0 :     page->xlp_pageaddr = wal_segment_size;

    5219                 :            :

    5222                 :          0 :     record = (XLogRecord *) recptr;

    5224                 :          0 :     record->xl_xid = InvalidTransactionId;
    5225                 :          0 :     record->xl_tot_len = SizeOfXLogRecord + SizeOfXLogRecordDataHeaderShort + sizeof(checkPoint);
    5226                 :          0 :     record->xl_info = XLOG_CHECKPOINT_SHUTDOWN;

    5228                 :          0 :     recptr += SizeOfXLogRecord;
    5229                 :            :     /* fill the XLogRecordDataHeaderShort struct */

    5231                 :          0 :     *(recptr++) = sizeof(checkPoint);
    5232                 :          0 :     memcpy(recptr, &checkPoint, sizeof(checkPoint));
    5233                 :          0 :     recptr += sizeof(checkPoint);
    5234                 :            :     Assert(recptr - (char *) record == record->xl_tot_len);
    5235                 :            : 
    5236                 :          0 :     INIT_CRC32C(crc);
    5237                 :          0 :     COMP_CRC32C(crc, ((char *) record) + SizeOfXLogRecord, record->xl_tot_len - SizeOfXLogRecord);
    5238                 :          0 :     COMP_CRC32C(crc, (char *) record, offsetof(XLogRecord, xl_crc));
    5239                 :          0 :     FIN_CRC32C(crc);
    5240                 :          0 :     record->xl_crc = crc;
    5241                 :            : 
    5242                 :            :     /* Create first XLOG segment file */
    5243                 :          0 :     use_existent = false;

    5245                 :            : 
    5246                 :            :     /* Write the first page with the initial record */
    5247                 :          0 :     errno = 0;
    5248                 :          0 :     pgstat_report_wait_start(WAIT_EVENT_WAL_BOOTSTRAP_WRITE);
    5249         [ #  # ]:          0 :     if (write(openLogFile, page, XLOG_BLCKSZ) != XLOG_BLCKSZ)
    5250                 :            :     {
    5251                 :            :         /* if write didn't set errno, assume problem is no disk space */
    5252         [ #  # ]:          0 :         if (errno == 0)
    5253                 :          0 :             errno = ENOSPC;

    5255                 :            :                 (errcode_for_file_access(),

    5257                 :            :     }
    5258                 :          0 :     pgstat_report_wait_end();
    5259                 :            :

    5360                 :            :      * possibility of fsync failure, however.

    5500                 :            : static void
    5501                 :          0 : exitArchiveRecovery(TimeLineID endTLI, XLogRecPtr endOfLog)

    5504                 :            :     XLogSegNo   endLogSegNo;
    5505                 :            :     XLogSegNo   startLogSegNo;
    5506                 :            : 
    5507                 :            :     /* we always switch to a new timeline after archive recovery */
    5508                 :            :     Assert(endTLI != ThisTimeLineID);
    5509                 :            : 
    5510                 :            :     /*
    5511                 :            :      * We are no longer in archive recovery state.
    5512                 :            :      */
    5513                 :          0 :     InArchiveRecovery = false;
    5514                 :            : 
    5515                 :            :     /*
    5516                 :            :      * Update min recovery point one last time.
    5517                 :            :      */
    5518                 :          0 :     UpdateMinRecoveryPoint(InvalidXLogRecPtr, true);
    5519                 :            : 
    5520                 :            :     /*
    5521                 :            :      * If the ending log segment is still open, close it (to avoid problems on
    5522                 :            :      * Windows with trying to rename or delete an open file).
    5523                 :            :      */
    5524         [ #  # ]:          0 :     if (readFile >= 0)
    5525                 :            :     {
    5526                 :          0 :         close(readFile);
    5527                 :          0 :         readFile = -1;
    5528                 :            :     }
    5529                 :            : 
    5530                 :            :     /*
    5531                 :            :      * Calculate the last segment on the old timeline, and the first segment
    5532                 :            :      * on the new timeline. If the switch happens in the middle of a segment,
    5533                 :            :      * they are the same, but if the switch happens exactly at a segment
    5534                 :            :      * boundary, startLogSegNo will be endLogSegNo + 1.
    5535                 :            :      */
    5536                 :          0 :     XLByteToPrevSeg(endOfLog, endLogSegNo, wal_segment_size);
    5537                 :          0 :     XLByteToSeg(endOfLog, startLogSegNo, wal_segment_size);
    5538                 :            : 
    5539                 :            :     /*
    5540                 :            :      * Initialize the starting WAL segment for the new timeline. If the switch
    5541                 :            :      * happens in the middle of a segment, copy data from the last WAL segment
    5542                 :            :      * of the old timeline up to the switch point, to the starting WAL segment
    5543                 :            :      * on the new timeline.
    5544                 :            :      */
    5545         [ #  # ]:          0 :     if (endLogSegNo == startLogSegNo)
    5546                 :            :     {
    5547                 :            :         /*
    5548                 :            :          * Make a copy of the file on the new timeline.
    5549                 :            :          *
    5550                 :            :          * Writing WAL isn't allowed yet, so there are no locking
    5551                 :            :          * considerations. But we should be just as tense as XLogFileInit to
    5552                 :            :          * avoid emplacing a bogus file.
    5553                 :            :          */
    5554                 :          0 :         XLogFileCopy(endLogSegNo, endTLI, endLogSegNo,
    5555                 :          0 :                      XLogSegmentOffset(endOfLog, wal_segment_size));
    5556                 :            :     }
    5557                 :            :     else
    5558                 :            :     {
    5559                 :            :         /*
    5560                 :            :          * The switch happened at a segment boundary, so just create the next
    5561                 :            :          * segment on the new timeline.
    5562                 :            :          */
    5563                 :          0 :         bool        use_existent = true;
    5564                 :            :         int         fd;
    5565                 :            : 
    5566                 :          0 :         fd = XLogFileInit(startLogSegNo, &use_existent, true);
    5567                 :            : 
    5568         [ #  # ]:          0 :         if (close(fd))
    5569         [ #  # ]:          0 :             ereport(ERROR,
    5570                 :            :                     (errcode_for_file_access(),
    5571                 :            :                      errmsg("could not close file \"%s\": %m",
    5572                 :            :                             XLogFileNameP(ThisTimeLineID, startLogSegNo))));
    5573                 :            :     }
    5574                 :            : 
    5575                 :            :     /*
    5576                 :            :      * Let's just make real sure there are not .ready or .done flags posted
    5577                 :            :      * for the new segment.
    5578                 :            :      */
    5579                 :          0 :     XLogFileName(xlogfname, ThisTimeLineID, startLogSegNo, wal_segment_size);
    5580                 :          0 :     XLogArchiveCleanup(xlogfname);
    5581                 :            : 
    5582                 :            :     /*
    5583                 :            :      * Remove the signal files out of the way, so that we don't accidentally
    5584                 :            :      * re-enter archive recovery mode in a subsequent crash.
    5585                 :            :      */
    5586         [ #  # ]:          0 :     if (standby_signal_file_found)
    5587                 :          0 :         durable_unlink(STANDBY_SIGNAL_FILE, FATAL);
    5588                 :            : 
    5589         [ #  # ]:          0 :     if (recovery_signal_file_found)
    5590                 :          0 :         durable_unlink(RECOVERY_SIGNAL_FILE, FATAL);
    5591                 :            : 
    5592         [ #  # ]:          0 :     ereport(LOG,
    5593                 :            :             (errmsg("archive recovery complete")));
    5594                 :          0 : }
    5595                 :            : 
    5596                 :            : /*
    5597                 :            :  * Extract timestamp from WAL record.
    5598                 :            :  *
    5599                 :            :  * If the record contains a timestamp, returns true, and saves the timestamp
    5600                 :            :  * in *recordXtime. If the record type has no timestamp, returns false.
    5601                 :            :  * Currently, only transaction commit/abort records and restore points contain
    5602                 :            :  * timestamps.
    5603                 :            :  */
    5604                 :            : static bool
    5605                 :          0 : getRecordTimestamp(XLogReaderState *record, TimestampTz *recordXtime)
    5606                 :            : {
    5607                 :          0 :     uint8       info = XLogRecGetInfo(record) & ~XLR_INFO_MASK;

    5610                 :            : 
    5611 [ #  # ][ #  # ]:          0 :     if (rmid == RM_XLOG_ID && info == XLOG_RESTORE_POINT)
    5612                 :            :     {
    5613                 :          0 :         *recordXtime = ((xl_restore_point *) XLogRecGetData(record))->rp_time;
    5614                 :          0 :         return true;
    5615                 :            :     }
    5616 [ #  # ][ #  # ]:          0 :     if (rmid == RM_XACT_ID && (xact_info == XLOG_XACT_COMMIT ||
                 [ #  # ]
    5617                 :            :                                xact_info == XLOG_XACT_COMMIT_PREPARED))
    5618                 :            :     {
    5619                 :          0 :         *recordXtime = ((xl_xact_commit *) XLogRecGetData(record))->xact_time;
    5620                 :          0 :         return true;
    5621                 :            :     }
    5622 [ #  # ][ #  # ]:          0 :     if (rmid == RM_XACT_ID && (xact_info == XLOG_XACT_ABORT ||

    5623                 :            :                                xact_info == XLOG_XACT_ABORT_PREPARED))
    5624                 :            :     {
    5625                 :          0 :         *recordXtime = ((xl_xact_abort *) XLogRecGetData(record))->xact_time;
    5626                 :          0 :         return true;
    5627                 :            :     }
    5628                 :          0 :     return false;
    5629                 :            : }
    5630                 :            : 
    5631                 :            : /*
    5632                 :            :  * For point-in-time recovery, this function decides whether we want to
    5633                 :            :  * stop applying the XLOG before the current record.
    5634                 :            :  *
    5635                 :            :  * Returns true if we are stopping, false otherwise. If stopping, some
    5636                 :            :  * information is saved in recoveryStopXid et al for use in annotating the
    5637                 :            :  * new timeline's history file.
    5638                 :            :  */
    5639                 :            : static bool
    5640                 :          0 : recoveryStopsBefore(XLogReaderState *record)
    5641                 :            : {
    5642                 :          0 :     bool        stopsHere = false;
    5643                 :            :     uint8       xact_info;
    5644                 :            :     bool        isCommit;
    5645                 :          0 :     TimestampTz recordXtime = 0;
    5646                 :            :     TransactionId recordXid;
    5647                 :            : 
    5648                 :            :     /*
    5649                 :            :      * Ignore recovery target settings when not in archive recovery (meaning
    5650                 :            :      * we are in crash recovery).
    5651                 :            :      */
    5652         [ #  # ]:          0 :     if (!ArchiveRecoveryRequested)
    5653                 :          0 :         return false;
    5654                 :            : 
    5655                 :            :     /* Check if we should stop as soon as reaching consistency */
    5656 [ #  # ][ #  # ]:          0 :     if (recoveryTarget == RECOVERY_TARGET_IMMEDIATE && reachedConsistency)
    5657                 :            :     {
    5658         [ #  # ]:          0 :         ereport(LOG,
    5659                 :            :                 (errmsg("recovery stopping after reaching consistency")));
    5660                 :            : 
    5661                 :          0 :         recoveryStopAfter = false;
    5662                 :          0 :         recoveryStopXid = InvalidTransactionId;
    5663                 :          0 :         recoveryStopLSN = InvalidXLogRecPtr;
    5664                 :          0 :         recoveryStopTime = 0;
    5665                 :          0 :         recoveryStopName[0] = '\0';
    5666                 :          0 :         return true;
    5667                 :            :     }
    5668                 :            : 
    5669                 :            :     /* Check if target LSN has been reached */
    5670 [ #  # ][ #  # ]:          0 :     if (recoveryTarget == RECOVERY_TARGET_LSN &&
    5671         [ #  # ]:          0 :         !recoveryTargetInclusive &&
    5672                 :          0 :         record->ReadRecPtr >= recoveryTargetLSN)
    5673                 :            :     {
    5674                 :          0 :         recoveryStopAfter = false;
    5675                 :          0 :         recoveryStopXid = InvalidTransactionId;

    5677                 :          0 :         recoveryStopTime = 0;
    5678                 :          0 :         recoveryStopName[0] = '\0';
    5679         [ #  # ]:          0 :         ereport(LOG,

    5681                 :            :                         (uint32) (recoveryStopLSN >> 32),
    5682                 :            :                         (uint32) recoveryStopLSN)));
    5683                 :          0 :         return true;
    5684                 :            :     }
    5685                 :            : 
    5686                 :            :     /* Otherwise we only consider stopping before COMMIT or ABORT records. */
    5687         [ #  # ]:          0 :     if (XLogRecGetRmid(record) != RM_XACT_ID)
    5688                 :          0 :         return false;
    5689                 :            :

    5691                 :            :

    5693                 :            :     {
    5694                 :          0 :         isCommit = true;
    5695                 :          0 :         recordXid = XLogRecGetXid(record);
    5696                 :            :     }
    5697         [ #  # ]:          0 :     else if (xact_info == XLOG_XACT_COMMIT_PREPARED)
    5698                 :            :     {
    5699                 :          0 :         xl_xact_commit *xlrec = (xl_xact_commit *) XLogRecGetData(record);

    5703                 :          0 :         ParseCommitRecord(XLogRecGetInfo(record),
    5704                 :            :                           xlrec,
    5705                 :            :                           &parsed);
    5706                 :          0 :         recordXid = parsed.twophase_xid;
    5707                 :            :     }
    5708         [ #  # ]:          0 :     else if (xact_info == XLOG_XACT_ABORT)
    5709                 :            :     {
    5710                 :          0 :         isCommit = false;
    5711                 :          0 :         recordXid = XLogRecGetXid(record);
    5712                 :            :     }
    5713         [ #  # ]:          0 :     else if (xact_info == XLOG_XACT_ABORT_PREPARED)
    5714                 :            :     {
    5715                 :          0 :         xl_xact_abort *xlrec = (xl_xact_abort *) XLogRecGetData(record);

    5720                 :            :                          xlrec,
    5721                 :            :                          &parsed);
    5722                 :          0 :         recordXid = parsed.twophase_xid;
    5723                 :            :     }
    5724                 :            :     else
    5725                 :          0 :         return false;
    5726                 :            : 
    5727 [ #  # ][ #  # ]:          0 :     if (recoveryTarget == RECOVERY_TARGET_XID && !recoveryTargetInclusive)
    5728                 :            :     {
    5729                 :            :         /*
    5730                 :            :          * There can be only one transaction end record with this exact
    5731                 :            :          * transactionid
    5732                 :            :          *
    5733                 :            :          * when testing for an xid, we MUST test for equality only, since
    5734                 :            :          * transactions are numbered in the order they start, not the order
    5735                 :            :          * they complete. A higher numbered xid will complete before you about
    5736                 :            :          * 50% of the time...
    5737                 :            :          */
    5738                 :          0 :         stopsHere = (recordXid == recoveryTargetXid);
    5739                 :            :     }
    5740                 :            : 
    5741   [ #  #  #  # ]:          0 :     if (recoveryTarget == RECOVERY_TARGET_TIME &&
    5742                 :          0 :         getRecordTimestamp(record, &recordXtime))
    5743                 :            :     {
    5744                 :            :         /*
    5745                 :            :          * There can be many transactions that share the same commit time, so
    5746                 :            :          * we stop after the last one, if we are inclusive, or stop at the
    5747                 :            :          * first one if we are exclusive
    5748                 :            :          */
    5749         [ #  # ]:          0 :         if (recoveryTargetInclusive)
    5750                 :          0 :             stopsHere = (recordXtime > recoveryTargetTime);
    5751                 :            :         else
    5752                 :          0 :             stopsHere = (recordXtime >= recoveryTargetTime);
    5753                 :            :     }
    5754                 :            : 
    5755         [ #  # ]:          0 :     if (stopsHere)
    5756                 :            :     {
    5757                 :          0 :         recoveryStopAfter = false;
    5758                 :          0 :         recoveryStopXid = recordXid;
    5759                 :          0 :         recoveryStopTime = recordXtime;
    5760                 :          0 :         recoveryStopLSN = InvalidXLogRecPtr;
    5761                 :          0 :         recoveryStopName[0] = '\0';
    5762                 :            : 
    5763         [ #  # ]:          0 :         if (isCommit)
    5764                 :            :         {
    5765         [ #  # ]:          0 :             ereport(LOG,
    5766                 :            :                     (errmsg("recovery stopping before commit of transaction %u, time %s",
    5767                 :            :                             recoveryStopXid,
    5768                 :            :                             timestamptz_to_str(recoveryStopTime))));
    5769                 :            :         }
    5770                 :            :         else
    5771                 :            :         {
    5772         [ #  # ]:          0 :             ereport(LOG,
    5773                 :            :                     (errmsg("recovery stopping before abort of transaction %u, time %s",
    5774                 :            :                             recoveryStopXid,
    5775                 :            :                             timestamptz_to_str(recoveryStopTime))));
    5776                 :            :         }
    5777                 :            :     }
    5778                 :            : 
    5779                 :          0 :     return stopsHere;
    5780                 :            : }
    5781                 :            : 
    5782                 :            : /*
    5783                 :            :  * Same as recoveryStopsBefore, but called after applying the record.
    5784                 :            :  *

    5786                 :            :  * record in XLogCtl->recoveryLastXTime.

    5945                 :            : /*
    5946                 :            :  * Wait until shared recoveryPause flag is cleared.
    5947                 :            :  *
    5948                 :            :  * XXX Could also be done with shared latch, avoiding the pg_usleep loop.
    5949                 :            :  * Probably not worth the trouble though.  This state shouldn't be one that
    5950                 :            :  * anyone cares about server power consumption in.
    5951                 :            :  */
    5952                 :            : static void
    5953                 :          0 : recoveryPausesHere(void)
    5954                 :            : {
    5955                 :            :     /* Don't pause unless users can connect! */
    5956         [ #  # ]:          0 :     if (!LocalHotStandbyActive)
    5957                 :          0 :         return;
    5958                 :            : 
    5959         [ #  # ]:          0 :     ereport(LOG,
    5960                 :            :             (errmsg("recovery has paused"),
    5961                 :            :              errhint("Execute pg_wal_replay_resume() to continue.")));
    5962                 :            : 
    5963         [ #  # ]:          0 :     while (RecoveryIsPaused())
    5964                 :            :     {
    5965                 :          0 :         pg_usleep(1000000L);    /* 1000 ms */
    5966                 :          0 :         HandleStartupProcInterrupts();
    5967                 :            :     }
    5968                 :            : }
    5969                 :            : 
    5970                 :            : bool
    5971                 :          0 : RecoveryIsPaused(void)

    5974                 :            : 
    5975         [ #  # ]:          0 :     SpinLockAcquire(&XLogCtl->info_lck);

    5977                 :          0 :     SpinLockRelease(&XLogCtl->info_lck);
    5978                 :            : 
    5979                 :          0 :     return recoveryPause;
    5980                 :            : }
    5981                 :            : 
    5982                 :            : void

    5984                 :            : {
    5985         [ #  # ]:          0 :     SpinLockAcquire(&XLogCtl->info_lck);
    5986                 :          0 :     XLogCtl->recoveryPause = recoveryPause;
    5987                 :          0 :     SpinLockRelease(&XLogCtl->info_lck);
    5988                 :          0 : }
    5989                 :            : 
    5990                 :            : /*
    5991                 :            :  * When recovery_min_apply_delay is set, we wait long enough to make sure
    5992                 :            :  * certain record types are applied at least that interval behind the master.
    5993                 :            :  *
    5994                 :            :  * Returns true if we waited.
    5995                 :            :  *
    5996                 :            :  * Note that the delay is calculated between the WAL record log time and
    5997                 :            :  * the current time on standby. We would prefer to keep track of when this
    5998                 :            :  * standby received each WAL record, which would allow a more consistent
    5999                 :            :  * approach and one not affected by time synchronisation issues, but that
    6000                 :            :  * is significantly more effort and complexity for little actual gain in
    6001                 :            :  * usability.
    6002                 :            :  */
    6003                 :            : static bool
    6004                 :          0 : recoveryApplyDelay(XLogReaderState *record)
    6005                 :            : {
    6006                 :            :     uint8       xact_info;
    6007                 :            :     TimestampTz xtime;
    6008                 :            :     long        msecs;
    6009                 :            : 
    6010                 :            :     /* nothing to do if no delay configured */
    6011         [ #  # ]:          0 :     if (recovery_min_apply_delay <= 0)
    6012                 :          0 :         return false;
    6013                 :            : 
    6014                 :            :     /* no delay is applied on a database not yet consistent */
    6015         [ #  # ]:          0 :     if (!reachedConsistency)
    6016                 :          0 :         return false;
    6017                 :            : 
    6018                 :            :     /* nothing to do if crash recovery is requested */
    6019         [ #  # ]:          0 :     if (!ArchiveRecoveryRequested)
    6020                 :          0 :         return false;
    6021                 :            : 
    6022                 :            :     /*
    6023                 :            :      * Is it a COMMIT record?
    6024                 :            :      *
    6025                 :            :      * We deliberately choose not to delay aborts since they have no effect on
    6026                 :            :      * MVCC. We already allow replay of records that don't have a timestamp,
    6027                 :            :      * so there is already opportunity for issues caused by early conflicts on
    6028                 :            :      * standbys.
    6029                 :            :      */
    6030         [ #  # ]:          0 :     if (XLogRecGetRmid(record) != RM_XACT_ID)
    6031                 :          0 :         return false;
    6032                 :            : 
    6033                 :          0 :     xact_info = XLogRecGetInfo(record) & XLOG_XACT_OPMASK;
    6034                 :            : 
    6035 [ #  # ][ #  # ]:          0 :     if (xact_info != XLOG_XACT_COMMIT &&
    6036                 :            :         xact_info != XLOG_XACT_COMMIT_PREPARED)
    6037                 :          0 :         return false;
    6038                 :            : 
    6039         [ #  # ]:          0 :     if (!getRecordTimestamp(record, &xtime))
    6040                 :          0 :         return false;
    6041                 :            : 
    6042                 :          0 :     recoveryDelayUntilTime =
    6043                 :          0 :         TimestampTzPlusMilliseconds(xtime, recovery_min_apply_delay);
    6044                 :            : 
    6045                 :            :     /*
    6046                 :            :      * Exit without arming the latch if it's already past time to apply this
    6047                 :            :      * record
    6048                 :            :      */
    6049                 :          0 :     msecs = TimestampDifferenceMilliseconds(GetCurrentTimestamp(),
    6050                 :            :                                             recoveryDelayUntilTime);
    6051         [ #  # ]:          0 :     if (msecs <= 0)
    6052                 :          0 :         return false;
    6053                 :            : 
    6054                 :            :     while (true)
    6055                 :            :     {
    6056                 :          0 :         ResetLatch(&XLogCtl->recoveryWakeupLatch);
    6057                 :            : 
    6058                 :            :         /* might change the trigger file's location */
    6059                 :          0 :         HandleStartupProcInterrupts();
    6060                 :            : 
    6061         [ #  # ]:          0 :         if (CheckForStandbyTrigger())
    6062                 :          0 :             break;
    6063                 :            : 
    6064                 :            :         /*
    6065                 :            :          * Wait for difference between GetCurrentTimestamp() and
    6066                 :            :          * recoveryDelayUntilTime
    6067                 :            :          */
    6068                 :          0 :         msecs = TimestampDifferenceMilliseconds(GetCurrentTimestamp(),
    6069                 :            :                                                 recoveryDelayUntilTime);
    6070                 :            : 
    6071         [ #  # ]:          0 :         if (msecs <= 0)
    6072                 :          0 :             break;
    6073                 :            : 
    6074                 :          0 :         elog(DEBUG2, "recovery apply delay %ld milliseconds", msecs);
    6075                 :            : 
    6076                 :          0 :         (void) WaitLatch(&XLogCtl->recoveryWakeupLatch,
    6077                 :            :                          WL_LATCH_SET | WL_TIMEOUT | WL_EXIT_ON_PM_DEATH,
    6078                 :            :                          msecs,
    6079                 :            :                          WAIT_EVENT_RECOVERY_APPLY_DELAY);
    6080                 :          0 :     }
    6081                 :          0 :     return true;
    6082                 :            : }
    6083                 :            : 
    6084                 :            : /*
    6085                 :            :  * Save timestamp of latest processed commit/abort record.
    6086                 :            :  *
    6087                 :            :  * We keep this in XLogCtl, not a simple static variable, so that it can be
    6088                 :            :  * seen by processes other than the startup process.  Note in particular
    6089                 :            :  * that CreateRestartPoint is executed in the checkpointer.
    6090                 :            :  */
    6091                 :            : static void
    6092                 :          0 : SetLatestXTime(TimestampTz xtime)
    6093                 :            : {
    6094         [ #  # ]:          0 :     SpinLockAcquire(&XLogCtl->info_lck);
    6095                 :          0 :     XLogCtl->recoveryLastXTime = xtime;
    6096                 :          0 :     SpinLockRelease(&XLogCtl->info_lck);
    6097                 :          0 : }
    6098                 :            : 
    6099                 :            : /*
    6100                 :            :  * Fetch timestamp of latest processed commit/abort record.
    6101                 :            :  */
    6102                 :            : TimestampTz
    6103                 :          0 : GetLatestXTime(void)
    6104                 :            : {
    6105                 :            :     TimestampTz xtime;
    6106                 :            : 
    6107         [ #  # ]:          0 :     SpinLockAcquire(&XLogCtl->info_lck);

    6109                 :          0 :     SpinLockRelease(&XLogCtl->info_lck);

    6111                 :          0 :     return xtime;

    6113                 :            : 
    6114                 :            : /*
    6115                 :            :  * Save timestamp of the next chunk of WAL records to apply.
    6116                 :            :  *

    6161                 :            : /*
    6162                 :            :  * Note that text field supplied is a parameter name and does not require

    6165                 :            : #define RecoveryRequiresIntParameter(param_name, currValue, minValue) \
    6166                 :            : do { \
    6167                 :            :     if ((currValue) < (minValue)) \
    6168                 :            :         ereport(ERROR, \
    6169                 :            :                 (errcode(ERRCODE_INVALID_PARAMETER_VALUE), \

    6178                 :            : /*

    6182                 :            :  * Note that all the parameters which this function tests need to be
    6183                 :            :  * listed in Administrator's Overview section in high-availability.sgml.

    6317                 :            :      */
    6318                 :          1 :     ValidateXLOGDirectoryStructure();
    6319                 :            : 
    6320                 :            :     /*----------
    6321                 :            :      * If we previously crashed, perform a couple of actions:
    6322                 :            :      *  - The pg_wal directory may still include some temporary WAL segments
    6323                 :            :      * used when creating a new segment, so perform some clean up to not
    6324                 :            :      * bloat this path.  This is done first as there is no point to sync this
    6325                 :            :      * temporary data.
    6326                 :            :      *  - There might be data which we had written, intending to fsync it,
    6327                 :            :      * but which we had not actually fsync'd yet. Therefore, a power failure
    6328                 :            :      * in the near future might cause earlier unflushed writes to be lost,
    6329                 :            :      * even though more recent data written to disk from here on would be
    6330                 :            :      * persisted.  To avoid that, fsync the entire data directory.
    6331                 :            :      *---------
    6332                 :            :      */
    6333 [ -  + ][ #  # ]:          1 :     if (ControlFile->state != DB_SHUTDOWNED &&
    6334                 :          0 :         ControlFile->state != DB_SHUTDOWNED_IN_RECOVERY)

    6396         [ -  + ]:          1 :     if (!xlogreader)
    6397         [ #  # ]:          0 :         ereport(ERROR,

    6402                 :            : 
    6403                 :            :     /*
    6404                 :            :      * Allocate two page buffers dedicated to WAL consistency checks.  We do
    6405                 :            :      * it this way, rather than just making static arrays, for two reasons:
    6406                 :            :      * (1) no need to waste the storage in most instantiations of the backend;
    6407                 :            :      * (2) a static char array isn't guaranteed to have any particular
    6408                 :            :      * alignment, whereas palloc() will provide MAXALIGN'd storage.
    6409                 :            :      */
    6410                 :          1 :     replay_image_masked = (char *) palloc(BLCKSZ);

    6531                 :            :                                    TABLESPACE_MAP, TABLESPACE_MAP_OLD)));

    6533                 :            : 
    6534                 :            :         /*
    6535                 :            :          * It's possible that archive recovery was requested, but we don't
    6536                 :            :          * know how far we need to replay the WAL before we reach consistency.
    6537                 :            :          * This can happen for example if a base backup is taken from a
    6538                 :            :          * running server using an atomic filesystem snapshot, without calling
    6539                 :            :          * pg_start/stop_backup. Or if you just kill a running master server
    6540                 :            :          * and put it into archive recovery by creating a recovery signal
    6541                 :            :          * file.
    6542                 :            :          *
    6543                 :            :          * Our strategy in that case is to perform crash recovery first,
    6544                 :            :          * replaying all the WAL present in pg_wal, and only enter archive
    6545                 :            :          * recovery after that.
    6546                 :            :          *
    6547                 :            :          * But usually we already know how far we need to replay the WAL (up
    6548                 :            :          * to minRecoveryPoint, up to backupEndPoint, or until we see an
    6549                 :            :          * end-of-backup record), and we can enter archive recovery directly.
    6550                 :            :          */

    6552         [ #  # ]:          0 :             (ControlFile->minRecoveryPoint != InvalidXLogRecPtr ||

    6554         [ #  # ]:          0 :              ControlFile->backupEndPoint != InvalidXLogRecPtr ||

    6731                 :            :     /*

    6733                 :            :      * target timeline from archive to pg_wal. While we don't need those files
    6734                 :            :      * ourselves - the history file of the recovery target timeline covers all
    6735                 :            :      * the previous timelines in the history too - a cascading standby server
    6736                 :            :      * might be interested in them. Or, if you archive the WAL from this
    6737                 :            :      * server to a different archive than the master, it'd be good for all the
    6738                 :            :      * history files to get archived there after failover, so that you can use
    6739                 :            :      * one of the old timelines as a PITR target. Timeline history files are
    6740                 :            :      * small, so it's better to copy them unnecessarily than not copy them and
    6741                 :            :      * regret later.

    6743                 :          1 :     restoreTimeLineHistoryFiles(ThisTimeLineID, recoveryTargetTLI);

    6747                 :            :      * be able to work on entries generated by redo.  Doing a scan before
    6748                 :            :      * taking any recovery action has the merit to discard any 2PC files that
    6749                 :            :      * are newer than the first record to replay, saving from any conflicts at
    6750                 :            :      * replay.  This avoids as well any subsequent scans when doing recovery
    6751                 :            :      * of the on-disk two-phase data.

    6810         [ #  # ]:          0 :                 ereport(LOG,
    6811                 :            :                         (errmsg("crash recovery starts in timeline %u "
    6812                 :            :                                 "and has target timeline %u",
    6813                 :            :                                 ControlFile->checkPointCopy.ThisTimeLineID,
    6814                 :            :                                 recoveryTargetTLI)));
    6815                 :          0 :             ControlFile->state = DB_IN_CRASH_RECOVERY;
    6816                 :            : 
    6817         [ #  # ]:          0 :             SpinLockAcquire(&XLogCtl->info_lck);

    6819                 :          0 :             SpinLockRelease(&XLogCtl->info_lck);
    6820                 :            :         }

    6822                 :          0 :         ControlFile->checkPointCopy = checkPoint;
    6823         [ #  # ]:          0 :         if (InArchiveRecovery)
    6824                 :            :         {
    6825                 :            :             /* initialize minRecoveryPoint if not set yet */
    6826         [ #  # ]:          0 :             if (ControlFile->minRecoveryPoint < checkPoint.redo)
    6827                 :            :             {
    6828                 :          0 :                 ControlFile->minRecoveryPoint = checkPoint.redo;
    6829                 :          0 :                 ControlFile->minRecoveryPointTLI = checkPoint.ThisTimeLineID;
    6830                 :            :             }

    6832                 :            : 
    6833                 :            :         /*
    6834                 :            :          * Set backupStartPoint if we're starting recovery from a base backup.
    6835                 :            :          *
    6836                 :            :          * Also set backupEndPoint and use minRecoveryPoint as the backup end
    6837                 :            :          * location if we're starting recovery from a base backup which was
    6838                 :            :          * taken from a standby. In this case, the database system status in
    6839                 :            :          * pg_control must indicate that the database was already in recovery.
    6840                 :            :          * Usually that will be DB_IN_ARCHIVE_RECOVERY but also can be
    6841                 :            :          * DB_SHUTDOWNED_IN_RECOVERY if recovery previously was interrupted
    6842                 :            :          * before reaching this point; e.g. because restore_command or
    6843                 :            :          * primary_conninfo were faulty.
    6844                 :            :          *
    6845                 :            :          * Any other state indicates that the backup somehow became corrupted
    6846                 :            :          * and we can't sensibly continue with recovery.
    6847                 :            :          */
    6848         [ #  # ]:          0 :         if (haveBackupLabel)
    6849                 :            :         {
    6850                 :          0 :             ControlFile->backupStartPoint = checkPoint.redo;
    6851                 :          0 :             ControlFile->backupEndRequired = backupEndRequired;

    6860                 :            :                                      "have to use another backup for recovery.")));

    6862                 :            :             }
    6863                 :            :         }

    6866                 :          0 :         UpdateControlFile();
    6867                 :            : 
    6868                 :            :         /*
    6869                 :            :          * Initialize our local copy of minRecoveryPoint.  When doing crash
    6870                 :            :          * recovery we want to replay up to the end of WAL.  Particularly, in
    6871                 :            :          * the case of a promoted standby minRecoveryPoint value in the
    6872                 :            :          * control file is only updated after the first checkpoint.  However,
    6873                 :            :          * if the instance crashes before the first post-recovery checkpoint
    6874                 :            :          * is completed then recovery will use a stale location causing the
    6875                 :            :          * startup process to think that there are still invalid page
    6876                 :            :          * references when checking for data consistency.
    6877                 :            :          */
    6878         [ #  # ]:          0 :         if (InArchiveRecovery)

    6896                 :            :          * has now been propagated into pg_control.  We must get rid of the
    6897                 :            :          * label file so that if we crash during recovery, we'll pick up at
    6898                 :            :          * the latest recovery restartpoint instead of going all the way back
    6899                 :            :          * to the backup start point.  It seems prudent though to just rename
    6900                 :            :          * the file out of the way rather than delete it completely.
    6901                 :            :          */

    7034                 :            :          * Let postmaster know we've started redo now, so that it can launch
    7035                 :            :          * checkpointer to perform restartpoints.  We don't bother during
    7036                 :            :          * crash recovery as restartpoints can only be performed during
    7037                 :            :          * archive recovery.  And we'd like to keep crash recovery simple, to
    7038                 :            :          * avoid introducing bugs that could affect you when recovering after
    7039                 :            :          * crash.
    7040                 :            :          *
    7041                 :            :          * After this point, we can no longer assume that we're the only
    7042                 :            :          * process in addition to postmaster!  Also, fsync requests are
    7043                 :            :          * subsequently to be handled by the checkpointer, not locally.
    7044                 :            :          */

    7116                 :            :                  * SetRecoveryPause().

    7118                 :            :                  * Note that we intentionally don't take the info_lck spinlock
    7119                 :            :                  * here.  We might therefore read a slightly stale value of
    7120                 :            :                  * the recoveryPause flag, but it can't be very stale (no
    7121                 :            :                  * worse than the last spinlock we did acquire).  Since a
    7122                 :            :                  * pause request is a pretty asynchronous thing anyway,
    7123                 :            :                  * possibly responding to it one WAL record later than we
    7124                 :            :                  * otherwise would is a minor issue, so it doesn't seem worth
    7125                 :            :                  * adding another spinlock cycle to prevent that.

    7233                 :            :                  * the WAL record are consistent with the existing pages. This

    7235                 :            :                  * record.

    7241                 :          0 :                 error_context_stack = errcallback.previous;
    7242                 :            : 
    7243                 :            :                 /*
    7244                 :            :                  * Update lastReplayedEndRecPtr after this record has been
    7245                 :            :                  * successfully replayed.
    7246                 :            :                  */

    7249                 :          0 :                 XLogCtl->lastReplayedTLI = ThisTimeLineID;

    7254                 :            :                  * up the receiver so that it notices the updated

    7428                 :            :          * pg_stop_backup(), or you didn't archive all the WAL up to that
    7429                 :            :          * point. However, this also happens in crash recovery, if the system
    7430                 :            :          * crashes while an online backup is in progress. We must not treat
    7431                 :            :          * that as an error, or the database will refuse to start up.

    7455                 :            : 
    7456                 :            :     /*
    7457                 :            :      * Consider whether we need to assign a new timeline ID.
    7458                 :            :      *
    7459                 :            :      * If we are doing an archive recovery, we always assign a new ID.  This
    7460                 :            :      * handles a couple of issues.  If we stopped short of the end of WAL
    7461                 :            :      * during recovery, then we are clearly generating a new timeline and must
    7462                 :            :      * assign it a unique new ID.  Even if we ran to the end, modifying the
    7463                 :            :      * current last segment is problematic because it may result in trying to
    7464                 :            :      * overwrite an already-archived copy of that segment, and we encourage
    7465                 :            :      * DBAs to make their archive_commands reject that.  We can dodge the
    7466                 :            :      * problem by making the new active segment have a new timeline ID.
    7467                 :            :      *
    7468                 :            :      * In a normal crash recovery, we can just extend the timeline we were in.
    7469                 :            :      */
    7470                 :          1 :     PrevTimeLineID = ThisTimeLineID;
    7471         [ -  + ]:          1 :     if (ArchiveRecoveryRequested)
    7472                 :            :     {

    7518                 :            : 
    7519                 :            :         /*
    7520                 :            :          * Write the timeline history file, and have it archived. After this
    7521                 :            :          * point (or rather, as soon as the file is archived), the timeline
    7522                 :            :          * will appear as "taken" in the WAL archive and to any standby
    7523                 :            :          * servers.  If we crash before actually switching to the new
    7524                 :            :          * timeline, standby servers will nevertheless think that we switched
    7525                 :            :          * to the new timeline, and will try to connect to the new timeline.
    7526                 :            :          * To minimize the window for that, try to do as little as possible
    7527                 :            :          * between here and writing the end-of-recovery record.
    7528                 :            :          */

    7610         [ -  + ]:          1 :     if (InRecovery)
    7611                 :            :     {
    7612                 :            :         /*
    7613                 :            :          * Perform a checkpoint to update all our recovery activity to disk.
    7614                 :            :          *
    7615                 :            :          * Note that we write a shutdown checkpoint rather than an on-line
    7616                 :            :          * one. This is not particularly critical, but since we may be
    7617                 :            :          * assigning a new TLI, using a shutdown checkpoint allows us to have
    7618                 :            :          * the rule that TLI only changes in shutdown checkpoints, which
    7619                 :            :          * allows some extra error checking in xlog_redo.
    7620                 :            :          *
    7621                 :            :          * In fast promotion, only create a lightweight end-of-recovery record
    7622                 :            :          * instead of a full checkpoint. A checkpoint is requested later,
    7623                 :            :          * after we're fully out of recovery mode and already accepting
    7624                 :            :          * queries.
    7625                 :            :          */
    7626         [ #  # ]:          0 :         if (bgwriterLaunched)
    7627                 :            :         {
    7628         [ #  # ]:          0 :             if (fast_promote)
    7629                 :            :             {
    7630                 :          0 :                 checkPointLoc = ControlFile->checkPoint;
    7631                 :            : 
    7632                 :            :                 /*
    7633                 :            :                  * Confirm the last checkpoint is available for us to recover
    7634                 :            :                  * from if we fail.
    7635                 :            :                  */
    7636                 :          0 :                 record = ReadCheckpointRecord(xlogreader, checkPointLoc, 1, false);
    7637         [ #  # ]:          0 :                 if (record != NULL)
    7638                 :            :                 {
    7639                 :          0 :                     fast_promoted = true;
    7640                 :            : 
    7641                 :            :                     /*
    7642                 :            :                      * Insert a special WAL record to mark the end of
    7643                 :            :                      * recovery, since we aren't doing a checkpoint. That
    7644                 :            :                      * means that the checkpointer process may likely be in
    7645                 :            :                      * the middle of a time-smoothed restartpoint and could
    7646                 :            :                      * continue to be for minutes after this. That sounds
    7647                 :            :                      * strange, but the effect is roughly the same and it
    7648                 :            :                      * would be stranger to try to come out of the
    7649                 :            :                      * restartpoint and then checkpoint. We request a
    7650                 :            :                      * checkpoint later anyway, just for safety.
    7651                 :            :                      */
    7652                 :          0 :                     CreateEndOfRecoveryRecord();
    7653                 :            :                 }
    7654                 :            :             }
    7655                 :            : 
    7656         [ #  # ]:          0 :             if (!fast_promoted)
    7657                 :          0 :                 RequestCheckpoint(CHECKPOINT_END_OF_RECOVERY |
    7658                 :            :                                   CHECKPOINT_IMMEDIATE |
    7659                 :            :                                   CHECKPOINT_WAIT);
    7660                 :            :         }
    7661                 :            :         else
    7662                 :          0 :             CreateCheckPoint(CHECKPOINT_END_OF_RECOVERY | CHECKPOINT_IMMEDIATE);
    7663                 :            :     }
    7664                 :            :

    7672                 :            :                                    "recovery_end_command",
    7673                 :            :                                    true);
    7674                 :            : 
    7675                 :            :         /*
    7676                 :            :          * We switched to a new timeline. Clean up segments on the old
    7677                 :            :          * timeline.
    7678                 :            :          *
    7679                 :            :          * If there are any higher-numbered segments on the old timeline,
    7680                 :            :          * remove them. They might contain valid WAL, but they might also be
    7681                 :            :          * pre-allocated files containing garbage. In any case, they are not
    7682                 :            :          * part of the new timeline's history so we don't need them.
    7683                 :            :          */
    7684                 :          0 :         RemoveNonParentXlogFiles(EndOfLog, ThisTimeLineID);
    7685                 :            : 
    7686                 :            :         /*
    7687                 :            :          * If the switch happened in the middle of a segment, what to do with
    7688                 :            :          * the last, partial segment on the old timeline? If we don't archive
    7689                 :            :          * it, and the server that created the WAL never archives it either
    7690                 :            :          * (e.g. because it was hit by a meteor), it will never make it to the
    7691                 :            :          * archive. That's OK from our point of view, because the new segment
    7692                 :            :          * that we created with the new TLI contains all the WAL from the old
    7693                 :            :          * timeline up to the switch point. But if you later try to do PITR to
    7694                 :            :          * the "missing" WAL on the old timeline, recovery won't find it in
    7695                 :            :          * the archive. It's physically present in the new file with new TLI,
    7696                 :            :          * but recovery won't look there when it's recovering to the older
    7697                 :            :          * timeline. On the other hand, if we archive the partial segment, and
    7698                 :            :          * the original server on that timeline is still running and archives
    7699                 :            :          * the completed version of the same segment later, it will fail. (We
    7700                 :            :          * used to do that in 9.4 and below, and it caused such problems).
    7701                 :            :          *
    7702                 :            :          * As a compromise, we rename the last segment with the .partial
    7703                 :            :          * suffix, and archive it. Archive recovery will never try to read
    7704                 :            :          * .partial segments, so they will normally go unused. But in the odd
    7705                 :            :          * PITR case, the administrator can copy them manually to the pg_wal
    7706                 :            :          * directory (removing the suffix). They can be useful in debugging,
    7707                 :            :          * too.
    7708                 :            :          *
    7709                 :            :          * If a .done or .ready file already exists for the old timeline,
    7710                 :            :          * however, we had already determined that the segment is complete, so
    7711                 :            :          * we can let it be archived normally. (In particular, if it was
    7712                 :            :          * restored from the archive to begin with, it's expected to have a
    7713                 :            :          * .done file).
    7714                 :            :          */
    7715 [ #  # ][ #  # ]:          0 :         if (XLogSegmentOffset(EndOfLog, wal_segment_size) != 0 &&
    7716                 :            :             XLogArchivingActive())
    7717                 :            :         {
    7718                 :            :             char        origfname[MAXFNAMELEN];
    7719                 :            :             XLogSegNo   endLogSegNo;
    7720                 :            : 
    7721                 :          0 :             XLByteToPrevSeg(EndOfLog, endLogSegNo, wal_segment_size);
    7722                 :          0 :             XLogFileName(origfname, EndOfLogTLI, endLogSegNo, wal_segment_size);
    7723                 :            : 
    7724         [ #  # ]:          0 :             if (!XLogArchiveIsReadyOrDone(origfname))
    7725                 :            :             {
    7726                 :            :                 char        origpath[MAXPGPATH];
    7727                 :            :                 char        partialfname[MAXFNAMELEN];
    7728                 :            :                 char        partialpath[MAXPGPATH];
    7729                 :            : 
    7730                 :          0 :                 XLogFilePath(origpath, EndOfLogTLI, endLogSegNo, wal_segment_size);
    7731                 :          0 :                 snprintf(partialfname, MAXFNAMELEN, "%s.partial", origfname);
    7732                 :          0 :                 snprintf(partialpath, MAXPGPATH, "%s.partial", origpath);
    7733                 :            : 
    7734                 :            :                 /*
    7735                 :            :                  * Make sure there's no .done or .ready file for the .partial
    7736                 :            :                  * file.
    7737                 :            :                  */
    7738                 :          0 :                 XLogArchiveCleanup(partialfname);
    7739                 :            : 
    7740                 :          0 :                 durable_rename(origpath, partialpath, ERROR);
    7741                 :          0 :                 XLogArchiveNotify(partialfname);
    7742                 :            :             }
    7743                 :            :         }
    7744                 :            :     }
    7745                 :            : 
    7746                 :            :     /*
    7747                 :            :      * Preallocate additional log files, if wanted.
    7748                 :            :      */
    7749                 :          1 :     PreallocXlogFiles(EndOfLog);
    7750                 :            : 
    7751                 :            :     /*
    7752                 :            :      * Okay, we're officially UP.
    7753                 :            :      */
    7754                 :          1 :     InRecovery = false;
    7755                 :            : 
    7756                 :            :     /* start the archive_timeout timer and LSN running */
    7757                 :          1 :     XLogCtl->lastSegSwitchTime = (pg_time_t) time(NULL);
    7758                 :          1 :     XLogCtl->lastSegSwitchLSN = EndOfLog;
    7759                 :            : 
    7760                 :            :     /* also initialize latestCompletedXid, to nextXid - 1 */
    7761                 :          1 :     LWLockAcquire(ProcArrayLock, LW_EXCLUSIVE);
    7762                 :          1 :     ShmemVariableCache->latestCompletedXid = XidFromFullTransactionId(ShmemVariableCache->nextFullXid);
    7763         [ -  + ]:          1 :     TransactionIdRetreat(ShmemVariableCache->latestCompletedXid);
    7764                 :          1 :     LWLockRelease(ProcArrayLock);
    7765                 :            : 
    7766                 :            :     /*
    7767                 :            :      * Start up the commit log and subtrans, if not already done for hot
    7768                 :            :      * standby.  (commit timestamps are started below, if necessary.)
    7769                 :            :      */
    7770         [ +  - ]:          1 :     if (standbyState == STANDBY_DISABLED)
    7771                 :            :     {
    7772                 :          1 :         StartupCLOG();
    7773                 :          1 :         StartupSUBTRANS(oldestActiveXID);
    7774                 :            :     }
    7775                 :            : 
    7776                 :            :     /*
    7777                 :            :      * Perform end of recovery actions for any SLRUs that need it.
    7778                 :            :      */
    7779                 :          1 :     TrimCLOG();
    7780                 :          1 :     TrimMultiXact();
    7781                 :            : 
    7782                 :            :     /* Reload shared-memory state for prepared transactions */
    7783                 :          1 :     RecoverPreparedTransactions();
    7784                 :            : 
    7785                 :            :     /*
    7786                 :            :      * Shutdown the recovery environment. This must occur after
    7787                 :            :      * RecoverPreparedTransactions(), see notes for lock_twophase_recover()
    7788                 :            :      */
    7789         [ -  + ]:          1 :     if (standbyState != STANDBY_DISABLED)
    7790                 :          0 :         ShutdownRecoveryTransactionEnvironment();
    7791                 :            : 
    7792                 :            :     /* Shut down xlogreader */
    7793         [ +  - ]:          1 :     if (readFile >= 0)
    7794                 :            :     {
    7795                 :          1 :         close(readFile);
    7796                 :          1 :         readFile = -1;
    7797                 :            :     }
    7798                 :          1 :     XLogReaderFree(xlogreader);
    7799                 :            : 
    7800                 :            :     /*
    7801                 :            :      * If any of the critical GUCs have changed, log them before we allow
    7802                 :            :      * backends to write WAL.
    7803                 :            :      */
    7804                 :          1 :     LocalSetXLogInsertAllowed();
    7805                 :          1 :     XLogReportParameters();
    7806                 :            : 
    7807                 :            :     /*
    7808                 :            :      * Local WAL inserts enabled, so it's time to finish initialization of
    7809                 :            :      * commit timestamp.
    7810                 :            :      */
    7811                 :          1 :     CompleteCommitTsInitialization();
    7812                 :            : 
    7813                 :            :     /*
    7814                 :            :      * All done with end-of-recovery actions.
    7815                 :            :      *
    7816                 :            :      * Now allow backends to write WAL and update the control file status in
    7817                 :            :      * consequence.  The boolean flag allowing backends to write WAL is
    7818                 :            :      * updated while holding ControlFileLock to prevent other backends to look
    7819                 :            :      * at an inconsistent state of the control file in shared memory.  There
    7820                 :            :      * is still a small window during which backends can write WAL and the
    7821                 :            :      * control file is still referring to a system not in DB_IN_PRODUCTION
    7822                 :            :      * state while looking at the on-disk control file.
    7823                 :            :      *
    7824                 :            :      * Also, although the boolean flag to allow WAL is probably atomic in
    7825                 :            :      * itself, we use the info_lck here to ensure that there are no race
    7826                 :            :      * conditions concerning visibility of other recent updates to shared
    7827                 :            :      * memory.
    7828                 :            :      */
    7829                 :          1 :     LWLockAcquire(ControlFileLock, LW_EXCLUSIVE);
    7830                 :          1 :     ControlFile->state = DB_IN_PRODUCTION;
    7831                 :          1 :     ControlFile->time = (pg_time_t) time(NULL);
    7832                 :            : 
    7833         [ -  + ]:          1 :     SpinLockAcquire(&XLogCtl->info_lck);
    7834                 :          1 :     XLogCtl->SharedRecoveryState = RECOVERY_STATE_DONE;
    7835                 :          1 :     SpinLockRelease(&XLogCtl->info_lck);
    7836                 :            : 
    7837                 :          1 :     UpdateControlFile();
    7838                 :          1 :     LWLockRelease(ControlFileLock);
    7839                 :            : 
    7840                 :            :     /*
    7841                 :            :      * If there were cascading standby servers connected to us, nudge any wal
    7842                 :            :      * sender processes to notice that we've been promoted.
    7843                 :            :      */
    7844                 :          1 :     WalSndWakeup();
    7845                 :            : 
    7846                 :            :     /*
    7847                 :            :      * If this was a fast promotion, request an (online) checkpoint now. This
    7848                 :            :      * isn't required for consistency, but the last restartpoint might be far
    7849                 :            :      * back, and in case of a crash, recovering from it might take a longer
    7850                 :            :      * than is appropriate now that we're not in standby mode anymore.
    7851                 :            :      */
    7852         [ -  + ]:          1 :     if (fast_promoted)
    7853                 :          0 :         RequestCheckpoint(CHECKPOINT_FORCE);
    7854                 :          1 : }
    7855                 :            : 
    7856                 :            : /*
    7857                 :            :  * Checks if recovery has reached a consistent state. When consistency is
    7858                 :            :  * reached and we have a valid starting standby snapshot, tell postmaster
    7859                 :            :  * that it can start accepting read-only connections.
    7860                 :            :  */
    7861                 :            : static void
    7862                 :          0 : CheckRecoveryConsistency(void)
    7863                 :            : {
    7864                 :            :     XLogRecPtr  lastReplayedEndRecPtr;
    7865                 :            : 
    7866                 :            :     /*
    7867                 :            :      * During crash recovery, we don't reach a consistent state until we've
    7868                 :            :      * replayed all the WAL.
    7869                 :            :      */
    7870         [ #  # ]:          0 :     if (XLogRecPtrIsInvalid(minRecoveryPoint))
    7871                 :          0 :         return;

    7874                 :            : 
    7875                 :            :     /*
    7876                 :            :      * assume that we are called in the startup process, and hence don't need

    7882                 :            :      * Have we reached the point where our base backup was completed?
    7883                 :            :      */
