   10067                 :            : 
   10068                 :            : /*
   10069                 :            :  * Return the (possible) sync flag used for opening a file, depending on the
   10070                 :            :  * value of the GUC wal_sync_method.
   10071                 :            :  */
   10072                 :            : static int
   10073                 :        651 : get_sync_bit(int method)
   10074                 :            : {
   10075                 :        651 :     int         o_direct_flag = 0;
   10076                 :            : 
   10077                 :            :     /* If fsync is disabled, never open in sync mode */
   10078         [ -  + ]:        651 :     if (!enableFsync)
   10079                 :          0 :         return 0;
   10080                 :            : 
   10081                 :            :     /*
   10082                 :            :      * Optimize writes by bypassing kernel cache with O_DIRECT when using
   10083                 :            :      * O_SYNC/O_FSYNC and O_DSYNC.  But only if archiving and streaming are
   10084                 :            :      * disabled, otherwise the archive command or walsender process will read
   10085                 :            :      * the WAL soon after writing it, which is guaranteed to cause a physical
   10086                 :            :      * read if we bypassed the kernel cache. We also skip the
   10087                 :            :      * posix_fadvise(POSIX_FADV_DONTNEED) call in XLogFileClose() for the same
   10088                 :            :      * reason.
   10089                 :            :      *
   10090                 :            :      * Never use O_DIRECT in walreceiver process for similar reasons; the WAL
   10091                 :            :      * written by walreceiver is normally read by the startup process soon
   10092                 :            :      * after its written. Also, walreceiver performs unaligned writes, which
   10093                 :            :      * don't work with O_DIRECT, so it is required for correctness too.
   10094                 :            :      */
   10095 [ -  + ][ #  # ]:        651 :     if (!XLogIsNeeded() && !AmWalReceiverProcess())
   10096                 :          0 :         o_direct_flag = PG_O_DIRECT;
   10097                 :            : 
   10098   [ +  -  -  - ]:        651 :     switch (method)
   10099                 :            :     {
   10100                 :            :             /*
   10101                 :            :              * enum values for all sync options are defined even if they are
   10102                 :            :              * not supported on the current platform.  But if not, they are
   10103                 :            :              * not included in the enum option array, and therefore will never
   10104                 :            :              * be seen here.
   10105                 :            :              */
   10106                 :            :         case SYNC_METHOD_FSYNC:
   10107                 :            :         case SYNC_METHOD_FSYNC_WRITETHROUGH:
   10108                 :            :         case SYNC_METHOD_FDATASYNC:
   10109                 :        651 :             return 0;
   10110                 :            : #ifdef OPEN_SYNC_FLAG
   10111                 :            :         case SYNC_METHOD_OPEN:
   10112                 :          0 :             return OPEN_SYNC_FLAG | o_direct_flag;
   10113                 :            : #endif
   10114                 :            : #ifdef OPEN_DATASYNC_FLAG
   10115                 :            :         case SYNC_METHOD_OPEN_DSYNC:
   10116                 :          0 :             return OPEN_DATASYNC_FLAG | o_direct_flag;
   10117                 :            : #endif
   10118                 :            :         default:
   10119                 :            :             /* can't happen (unless we are out of sync with option array) */
   10120                 :          0 :             elog(ERROR, "unrecognized wal_sync_method: %d", method);
   10121                 :            :             return 0;           /* silence warning */
   10122                 :            :     }
   10123                 :            : }
   10124                 :            : 
   10125                 :            : /*
   10126                 :            :  * GUC support
   10127                 :            :  */
   10128                 :            : void
   10129                 :       1455 : assign_xlog_sync_method(int new_sync_method, void *extra)
   10130                 :            : {
   10131         [ -  + ]:       1455 :     if (sync_method != new_sync_method)
   10132                 :            :     {
   10133                 :            :         /*
   10134                 :            :          * To ensure that no blocks escape unsynced, force an fsync on the
   10135                 :            :          * currently open log segment (if any).  Also, if the open flag is
   10136                 :            :          * changing, close the log file so it will be reopened (with new flag
   10137                 :            :          * bit) at next use.
   10138                 :            :          */
   10139         [ #  # ]:          0 :         if (openLogFile >= 0)
   10140                 :            :         {
   10141                 :          0 :             pgstat_report_wait_start(WAIT_EVENT_WAL_SYNC_METHOD_ASSIGN);
   10142         [ #  # ]:          0 :             if (pg_fsync(openLogFile) != 0)
   10143         [ #  # ]:          0 :                 ereport(PANIC,
   10144                 :            :                         (errcode_for_file_access(),
   10145                 :            :                          errmsg("could not fsync file \"%s\": %m",
   10146                 :            :                                 XLogFileNameP(ThisTimeLineID, openLogSegNo))));
   10147                 :          0 :             pgstat_report_wait_end();
   10148         [ #  # ]:          0 :             if (get_sync_bit(sync_method) != get_sync_bit(new_sync_method))
   10149                 :          0 :                 XLogFileClose();
   10150                 :            :         }
   10151                 :            :     }
   10152                 :       1455 : }
   10153                 :            : 
   10154                 :            : 
   10155                 :            : /*
   10156                 :            :  * Issue appropriate kind of fsync (if any) for an XLOG output file.
   10157                 :            :  *
   10158                 :            :  * 'fd' is a file descriptor for the XLOG file to be fsync'd.
   10159                 :            :  * 'segno' is for error reporting purposes.
   10160                 :            :  */
   10161                 :            : void
   10162                 :      88212 : issue_xlog_fsync(int fd, XLogSegNo segno)
   10163                 :            : {
   10164                 :      88212 :     pgstat_report_wait_start(WAIT_EVENT_WAL_SYNC);
   10165   [ -  +  -  - ]:      88212 :     switch (sync_method)
   10166                 :            :     {
   10167                 :            :         case SYNC_METHOD_FSYNC:
   10168         [ #  # ]:          0 :             if (pg_fsync_no_writethrough(fd) != 0)
   10169         [ #  # ]:          0 :                 ereport(PANIC,
   10170                 :            :                         (errcode_for_file_access(),
   10171                 :            :                          errmsg("could not fsync file \"%s\": %m",
   10172                 :            :                                 XLogFileNameP(ThisTimeLineID, segno))));
   10173                 :          0 :             break;
   10174                 :            : #ifdef HAVE_FSYNC_WRITETHROUGH
   10175                 :            :         case SYNC_METHOD_FSYNC_WRITETHROUGH:
   10176                 :            :             if (pg_fsync_writethrough(fd) != 0)
   10177                 :            :                 ereport(PANIC,
   10178                 :            :                         (errcode_for_file_access(),
   10179                 :            :                          errmsg("could not fsync write-through file \"%s\": %m",
   10180                 :            :                                 XLogFileNameP(ThisTimeLineID, segno))));
   10181                 :            :             break;
   10182                 :            : #endif
   10183                 :            : #ifdef HAVE_FDATASYNC
   10184                 :            :         case SYNC_METHOD_FDATASYNC:

   10186         [ #  # ]:          0 :                 ereport(PANIC,
   10187                 :            :                         (errcode_for_file_access(),

   10189                 :            :                                 XLogFileNameP(ThisTimeLineID, segno))));

   10191                 :            : #endif
   10192                 :            :         case SYNC_METHOD_OPEN:
   10193                 :            :         case SYNC_METHOD_OPEN_DSYNC:

   10195                 :          0 :             break;

   10202                 :            : 
   10203                 :            : /*
   10204                 :            :  * Return the filename of given log segment, as a palloc'd string.
   10205                 :            :  */
   10206                 :            : char *
   10207                 :          0 : XLogFileNameP(TimeLineID tli, XLogSegNo segno)
   10208                 :            : {
   10209                 :          0 :     char       *result = palloc(MAXFNAMELEN);
   10210                 :            : 
   10211                 :          0 :     XLogFileName(result, tli, segno, wal_segment_size);
   10212                 :          0 :     return result;
   10213                 :            : }
   10214                 :            : 
   10215                 :            : /*
   10216                 :            :  * do_pg_start_backup
   10217                 :            :  *
   10218                 :            :  * Utility function called at the start of an online backup. It creates the
   10219                 :            :  * necessary starting checkpoint and constructs the backup label file.
   10220                 :            :  *
   10221                 :            :  * There are two kind of backups: exclusive and non-exclusive. An exclusive
   10222                 :            :  * backup is started with pg_start_backup(), and there can be only one active
   10223                 :            :  * at a time. The backup and tablespace map files of an exclusive backup are
   10224                 :            :  * written to $PGDATA/backup_label and $PGDATA/tablespace_map, and they are
   10225                 :            :  * removed by pg_stop_backup().
   10226                 :            :  *
   10227                 :            :  * A non-exclusive backup is used for the streaming base backups (see
   10228                 :            :  * src/backend/replication/basebackup.c). The difference to exclusive backups
   10229                 :            :  * is that the backup label and tablespace map files are not written to disk.
   10230                 :            :  * Instead, their would-be contents are returned in *labelfile and *tblspcmapfile,
   10231                 :            :  * and the caller is responsible for including them in the backup archive as
   10232                 :            :  * 'backup_label' and 'tablespace_map'. There can be many non-exclusive backups
   10233                 :            :  * active at the same time, and they don't conflict with an exclusive backup
   10234                 :            :  * either.
   10235                 :            :  *
   10236                 :            :  * tblspcmapfile is required mainly for tar format in windows as native windows
   10237                 :            :  * utilities are not able to create symlinks while extracting files from tar.
   10238                 :            :  * However for consistency, the same is used for all platforms.
   10239                 :            :  *
   10240                 :            :  * needtblspcmapfile is true for the cases (exclusive backup and for
   10241                 :            :  * non-exclusive backup only when tar format is used for taking backup)
   10242                 :            :  * when backup needs to generate tablespace_map file, it is used to
   10243                 :            :  * embed escape character before newline character in tablespace path.
   10244                 :            :  *
   10245                 :            :  * Returns the minimum WAL location that must be present to restore from this
   10246                 :            :  * backup, and the corresponding timeline ID in *starttli_p.
   10247                 :            :  *
   10248                 :            :  * Every successfully started non-exclusive backup must be stopped by calling
   10249                 :            :  * do_pg_stop_backup() or do_pg_abort_backup().
   10250                 :            :  *
   10251                 :            :  * It is the responsibility of the caller of this function to verify the
   10252                 :            :  * permissions of the calling user!
   10253                 :            :  */
   10254                 :            : XLogRecPtr
   10255                 :          0 : do_pg_start_backup(const char *backupidstr, bool fast, TimeLineID *starttli_p,
   10256                 :            :                    StringInfo labelfile, List **tablespaces,
   10257                 :            :                    StringInfo tblspcmapfile, bool infotbssize,
   10258                 :            :                    bool needtblspcmapfile)
   10259                 :            : {
   10260                 :          0 :     bool        exclusive = (labelfile == NULL);
   10261                 :          0 :     bool        backup_started_in_recovery = false;
   10262                 :            :     XLogRecPtr  checkpointloc;
   10263                 :            :     XLogRecPtr  startpoint;
   10264                 :            :     TimeLineID  starttli;
   10265                 :            :     pg_time_t   stamp_time;
   10266                 :            :     char        strfbuf[128];
   10267                 :            :     char        xlogfilename[MAXFNAMELEN];
   10268                 :            :     XLogSegNo   _logSegNo;
   10269                 :            :     struct stat stat_buf;
   10270                 :            :     FILE       *fp;
   10271                 :            : 
   10272                 :          0 :     backup_started_in_recovery = RecoveryInProgress();
   10273                 :            : 
   10274                 :            :     /*
   10275                 :            :      * Currently only non-exclusive backup can be taken during recovery.
   10276                 :            :      */
   10277 [ #  # ][ #  # ]:          0 :     if (backup_started_in_recovery && exclusive)
   10278         [ #  # ]:          0 :         ereport(ERROR,
   10279                 :            :                 (errcode(ERRCODE_OBJECT_NOT_IN_PREREQUISITE_STATE),
   10280                 :            :                  errmsg("recovery is in progress"),
   10281                 :            :                  errhint("WAL control functions cannot be executed during recovery.")));
   10282                 :            : 
   10283                 :            :     /*
   10284                 :            :      * During recovery, we don't need to check WAL level. Because, if WAL
   10285                 :            :      * level is not sufficient, it's impossible to get here during recovery.
   10286                 :            :      */
   10287 [ #  # ][ #  # ]:          0 :     if (!backup_started_in_recovery && !XLogIsNeeded())
   10288         [ #  # ]:          0 :         ereport(ERROR,
   10289                 :            :                 (errcode(ERRCODE_OBJECT_NOT_IN_PREREQUISITE_STATE),
   10290                 :            :                  errmsg("WAL level not sufficient for making an online backup"),
   10291                 :            :                  errhint("wal_level must be set to \"replica\" or \"logical\" at server start.")));
   10292                 :            : 
   10293         [ #  # ]:          0 :     if (strlen(backupidstr) > MAXPGPATH)
   10294         [ #  # ]:          0 :         ereport(ERROR,
   10295                 :            :                 (errcode(ERRCODE_INVALID_PARAMETER_VALUE),
   10296                 :            :                  errmsg("backup label too long (max %d bytes)",
   10297                 :            :                         MAXPGPATH)));
   10298                 :            : 
   10299                 :            :     /*
   10300                 :            :      * Mark backup active in shared memory.  We must do full-page WAL writes
   10301                 :            :      * during an on-line backup even if not doing so at other times, because
   10302                 :            :      * it's quite possible for the backup dump to obtain a "torn" (partially
   10303                 :            :      * written) copy of a database page if it reads the page concurrently with
   10304                 :            :      * our write to the same page.  This can be fixed as long as the first
   10305                 :            :      * write to the page in the WAL sequence is a full-page write. Hence, we
   10306                 :            :      * turn on forcePageWrites and then force a CHECKPOINT, to ensure there
   10307                 :            :      * are no dirty pages in shared memory that might get dumped while the
   10308                 :            :      * backup is in progress without having a corresponding WAL record.  (Once
   10309                 :            :      * the backup is complete, we need not force full-page writes anymore,
   10310                 :            :      * since we expect that any pages not modified during the backup interval
   10311                 :            :      * must have been correctly captured by the backup.)
   10312                 :            :      *
   10313                 :            :      * Note that forcePageWrites has no effect during an online backup from
   10314                 :            :      * the standby.
   10315                 :            :      *
   10316                 :            :      * We must hold all the insertion locks to change the value of
   10317                 :            :      * forcePageWrites, to ensure adequate interlocking against
   10318                 :            :      * XLogInsertRecord().
   10319                 :            :      */
   10320                 :          0 :     WALInsertLockAcquireExclusive();
   10321         [ #  # ]:          0 :     if (exclusive)
   10322                 :            :     {
   10323                 :            :         /*
   10324                 :            :          * At first, mark that we're now starting an exclusive backup, to
   10325                 :            :          * ensure that there are no other sessions currently running
   10326                 :            :          * pg_start_backup() or pg_stop_backup().
   10327                 :            :          */
   10328         [ #  # ]:          0 :         if (XLogCtl->Insert.exclusiveBackupState != EXCLUSIVE_BACKUP_NONE)
   10329                 :            :         {
   10330                 :          0 :             WALInsertLockRelease();
   10331         [ #  # ]:          0 :             ereport(ERROR,
   10332                 :            :                     (errcode(ERRCODE_OBJECT_NOT_IN_PREREQUISITE_STATE),
   10333                 :            :                      errmsg("a backup is already in progress"),
   10334                 :            :                      errhint("Run pg_stop_backup() and try again.")));
   10335                 :            :         }
   10336                 :          0 :         XLogCtl->Insert.exclusiveBackupState = EXCLUSIVE_BACKUP_STARTING;
   10337                 :            :     }
   10338                 :            :     else
   10339                 :          0 :         XLogCtl->Insert.nonExclusiveBackups++;
   10340                 :          0 :     XLogCtl->Insert.forcePageWrites = true;
   10341                 :          0 :     WALInsertLockRelease();
   10342                 :            : 
   10343                 :            :     /* Ensure we release forcePageWrites if fail below */
   10344 [ #  # ][ #  # ]:          0 :     PG_ENSURE_ERROR_CLEANUP(pg_start_backup_callback, (Datum) BoolGetDatum(exclusive));
   10345                 :            :     {
   10346                 :          0 :         bool        gotUniqueStartpoint = false;
   10347                 :            :         DIR        *tblspcdir;
   10348                 :            :         struct dirent *de;
   10349                 :            :         tablespaceinfo *ti;
   10350                 :            :         int         datadirpathlen;
   10351                 :            : 
   10352                 :            :         /*
   10353                 :            :          * Force an XLOG file switch before the checkpoint, to ensure that the
   10354                 :            :          * WAL segment the checkpoint is written to doesn't contain pages with
   10355                 :            :          * old timeline IDs.  That would otherwise happen if you called
   10356                 :            :          * pg_start_backup() right after restoring from a PITR archive: the
   10357                 :            :          * first WAL segment containing the startup checkpoint has pages in
   10358                 :            :          * the beginning with the old timeline ID.  That can cause trouble at
   10359                 :            :          * recovery: we won't have a history file covering the old timeline if
   10360                 :            :          * pg_wal directory was not included in the base backup and the WAL
   10361                 :            :          * archive was cleared too before starting the backup.
   10362                 :            :          *
   10363                 :            :          * This also ensures that we have emitted a WAL page header that has
   10364                 :            :          * XLP_BKP_REMOVABLE off before we emit the checkpoint record.
   10365                 :            :          * Therefore, if a WAL archiver (such as pglesslog) is trying to
   10366                 :            :          * compress out removable backup blocks, it won't remove any that
   10367                 :            :          * occur after this point.
   10368                 :            :          *
   10369                 :            :          * During recovery, we skip forcing XLOG file switch, which means that
   10370                 :            :          * the backup taken during recovery is not available for the special
   10371                 :            :          * recovery case described above.
   10372                 :            :          */
   10373         [ #  # ]:          0 :         if (!backup_started_in_recovery)
   10374                 :          0 :             RequestXLogSwitch(false);
   10375                 :            : 
   10376                 :            :         do
   10377                 :            :         {
   10378                 :            :             bool        checkpointfpw;
   10379                 :            : 
   10380                 :            :             /*
   10381                 :            :              * Force a CHECKPOINT.  Aside from being necessary to prevent torn
   10382                 :            :              * page problems, this guarantees that two successive backup runs
   10383                 :            :              * will have different checkpoint positions and hence different
   10384                 :            :              * history file names, even if nothing happened in between.
   10385                 :            :              *
   10386                 :            :              * During recovery, establish a restartpoint if possible. We use
   10387                 :            :              * the last restartpoint as the backup starting checkpoint. This
   10388                 :            :              * means that two successive backup runs can have same checkpoint
   10389                 :            :              * positions.
   10390                 :            :              *
   10391                 :            :              * Since the fact that we are executing do_pg_start_backup()
   10392                 :            :              * during recovery means that checkpointer is running, we can use
   10393                 :            :              * RequestCheckpoint() to establish a restartpoint.
   10394                 :            :              *
   10395                 :            :              * We use CHECKPOINT_IMMEDIATE only if requested by user (via
   10396                 :            :              * passing fast = true).  Otherwise this can take awhile.
   10397                 :            :              */
   10398         [ #  # ]:          0 :             RequestCheckpoint(CHECKPOINT_FORCE | CHECKPOINT_WAIT |
   10399                 :            :                               (fast ? CHECKPOINT_IMMEDIATE : 0));
   10400                 :            : 
   10401                 :            :             /*
   10402                 :            :              * Now we need to fetch the checkpoint record location, and also
   10403                 :            :              * its REDO pointer.  The oldest point in WAL that would be needed
   10404                 :            :              * to restore starting from the checkpoint is precisely the REDO
   10405                 :            :              * pointer.
   10406                 :            :              */
   10407                 :          0 :             LWLockAcquire(ControlFileLock, LW_SHARED);
   10408                 :          0 :             checkpointloc = ControlFile->checkPoint;
   10409                 :          0 :             startpoint = ControlFile->checkPointCopy.redo;
   10410                 :          0 :             starttli = ControlFile->checkPointCopy.ThisTimeLineID;
   10411                 :          0 :             checkpointfpw = ControlFile->checkPointCopy.fullPageWrites;
   10412                 :          0 :             LWLockRelease(ControlFileLock);
   10413                 :            : 
   10414         [ #  # ]:          0 :             if (backup_started_in_recovery)
   10415                 :            :             {
   10416                 :            :                 XLogRecPtr  recptr;
   10417                 :            : 
   10418                 :            :                 /*
   10419                 :            :                  * Check to see if all WAL replayed during online backup
   10420                 :            :                  * (i.e., since last restartpoint used as backup starting
   10421                 :            :                  * checkpoint) contain full-page writes.
   10422                 :            :                  */
   10423         [ #  # ]:          0 :                 SpinLockAcquire(&XLogCtl->info_lck);
   10424                 :          0 :                 recptr = XLogCtl->lastFpwDisableRecPtr;
   10425                 :          0 :                 SpinLockRelease(&XLogCtl->info_lck);
   10426                 :            : 
   10427 [ #  # ][ #  # ]:          0 :                 if (!checkpointfpw || startpoint <= recptr)
   10428         [ #  # ]:          0 :                     ereport(ERROR,
   10429                 :            :                             (errcode(ERRCODE_OBJECT_NOT_IN_PREREQUISITE_STATE),
   10430                 :            :                              errmsg("WAL generated with full_page_writes=off was replayed "
   10431                 :            :                                     "since last restartpoint"),
   10432                 :            :                              errhint("This means that the backup being taken on the standby "
   10433                 :            :                                      "is corrupt and should not be used. "
   10434                 :            :                                      "Enable full_page_writes and run CHECKPOINT on the master, "
   10435                 :            :                                      "and then try an online backup again.")));
   10436                 :            : 
   10437                 :            :                 /*
   10438                 :            :                  * During recovery, since we don't use the end-of-backup WAL
   10439                 :            :                  * record and don't write the backup history file, the
   10440                 :            :                  * starting WAL location doesn't need to be unique. This means
   10441                 :            :                  * that two base backups started at the same time might use
   10442                 :            :                  * the same checkpoint as starting locations.
   10443                 :            :                  */
   10444                 :          0 :                 gotUniqueStartpoint = true;
   10445                 :            :             }
   10446                 :            : 
   10447                 :            :             /*
   10448                 :            :              * If two base backups are started at the same time (in WAL sender
   10449                 :            :              * processes), we need to make sure that they use different
   10450                 :            :              * checkpoints as starting locations, because we use the starting
   10451                 :            :              * WAL location as a unique identifier for the base backup in the
   10452                 :            :              * end-of-backup WAL record and when we write the backup history
   10453                 :            :              * file. Perhaps it would be better generate a separate unique ID
   10454                 :            :              * for each backup instead of forcing another checkpoint, but
   10455                 :            :              * taking a checkpoint right after another is not that expensive
   10456                 :            :              * either because only few buffers have been dirtied yet.
   10457                 :            :              */
   10458                 :          0 :             WALInsertLockAcquireExclusive();
   10459         [ #  # ]:          0 :             if (XLogCtl->Insert.lastBackupStart < startpoint)
   10460                 :            :             {
   10461                 :          0 :                 XLogCtl->Insert.lastBackupStart = startpoint;
   10462                 :          0 :                 gotUniqueStartpoint = true;
   10463                 :            :             }
   10464                 :          0 :             WALInsertLockRelease();
   10465         [ #  # ]:          0 :         } while (!gotUniqueStartpoint);
   10466                 :            : 
   10467                 :          0 :         XLByteToSeg(startpoint, _logSegNo, wal_segment_size);
   10468                 :          0 :         XLogFileName(xlogfilename, starttli, _logSegNo, wal_segment_size);
   10469                 :            : 
   10470                 :            :         /*
   10471                 :            :          * Construct tablespace_map file
   10472                 :            :          */

   10474                 :          0 :             tblspcmapfile = makeStringInfo();
   10475                 :            :

   10477                 :            :

   10479                 :          0 :         tblspcdir = AllocateDir("pg_tblspc");
   10480         [ #  # ]:          0 :         while ((de = ReadDir(tblspcdir, "pg_tblspc")) != NULL)

   10645         [ #  # ]:          0 :                     ereport(ERROR,
   10646                 :            :                             (errcode(ERRCODE_OBJECT_NOT_IN_PREREQUISITE_STATE),
   10647                 :            :                              errmsg("a backup is already in progress"),
   10648                 :            :                              errhint("If you're sure there is no backup in progress, remove file \"%s\" and try again.",
   10649                 :            :                                      TABLESPACE_MAP)));
   10650                 :            : 
   10651                 :          0 :                 fp = AllocateFile(TABLESPACE_MAP, "w");
   10652                 :            : 
   10653         [ #  # ]:          0 :                 if (!fp)
   10654         [ #  # ]:          0 :                     ereport(ERROR,
   10655                 :            :                             (errcode_for_file_access(),
   10656                 :            :                              errmsg("could not create file \"%s\": %m",
   10657                 :            :                                     TABLESPACE_MAP)));
   10658   [ #  #  #  # ]:          0 :                 if (fwrite(tblspcmapfile->data, tblspcmapfile->len, 1, fp) != 1 ||
   10659         [ #  # ]:          0 :                     fflush(fp) != 0 ||

   10661         [ #  # ]:          0 :                     ferror(fp) ||
   10662                 :          0 :                     FreeFile(fp))
   10663         [ #  # ]:          0 :                     ereport(ERROR,
   10664                 :            :                             (errcode_for_file_access(),

   10666                 :            :                                     TABLESPACE_MAP)));

   10670                 :          0 :             pfree(tblspcmapfile->data);
   10671                 :          0 :             pfree(tblspcmapfile);
   10672                 :            :         }
   10673                 :            :     }
   10674 [ #  # ][ #  # ]:          0 :     PG_END_ENSURE_ERROR_CLEANUP(pg_start_backup_callback, (Datum) BoolGetDatum(exclusive));

   10675                 :            : 
   10676                 :            :     /*
   10677                 :            :      * Mark that start phase has correctly finished for an exclusive backup.
   10678                 :            :      * Session-level locks are updated as well to reflect that state.
   10679                 :            :      *
   10680                 :            :      * Note that CHECK_FOR_INTERRUPTS() must not occur while updating backup
   10681                 :            :      * counters and session-level lock. Otherwise they can be updated
   10682                 :            :      * inconsistently, and which might cause do_pg_abort_backup() to fail.
   10683                 :            :      */
   10684         [ #  # ]:          0 :     if (exclusive)
   10685                 :            :     {
   10686                 :          0 :         WALInsertLockAcquireExclusive();
   10687                 :          0 :         XLogCtl->Insert.exclusiveBackupState = EXCLUSIVE_BACKUP_IN_PROGRESS;
   10688                 :            :

   10693                 :            :     else

   10697                 :            :      * We're done.  As a convenience, return the starting WAL location.
   10698                 :            :      */

   10700                 :          0 :         *starttli_p = starttli;

   10703                 :            : 
   10704                 :            : /* Error cleanup callback for pg_start_backup */

   10707                 :            : {
   10708                 :          0 :     bool        exclusive = DatumGetBool(arg);
   10709                 :            : 
   10710                 :            :     /* Update backup counters and forcePageWrites on failure */
   10711                 :          0 :     WALInsertLockAcquireExclusive();

   10731                 :            : /*

   10748                 :            : 
   10749                 :            : /*

   10757                 :            : 
   10758                 :            : /*
   10759                 :            :  * do_pg_stop_backup
   10760                 :            :  *
   10761                 :            :  * Utility function called at the end of an online backup. It cleans up the
   10762                 :            :  * backup state and can optionally wait for WAL segments to be archived.
   10763                 :            :  *
   10764                 :            :  * If labelfile is NULL, this stops an exclusive backup. Otherwise this stops
   10765                 :            :  * the non-exclusive backup specified by 'labelfile'.
   10766                 :            :  *
   10767                 :            :  * Returns the last WAL location that must be present to restore from this
   10768                 :            :  * backup, and the corresponding timeline ID in *stoptli_p.
   10769                 :            :  *
   10770                 :            :  * It is the responsibility of the caller of this function to verify the
   10771                 :            :  * permissions of the calling user!
   10772                 :            :  */
   10773                 :            : XLogRecPtr
   10774                 :          0 : do_pg_stop_backup(char *labelfile, bool waitforarchive, TimeLineID *stoptli_p)
   10775                 :            : {
   10776                 :          0 :     bool        exclusive = (labelfile == NULL);
   10777                 :          0 :     bool        backup_started_in_recovery = false;

   10791                 :            :     FILE       *fp;

   10800                 :            : 
   10801                 :          0 :     backup_started_in_recovery = RecoveryInProgress();
   10802                 :            : 
   10803                 :            :     /*
   10804                 :            :      * Currently only non-exclusive backup can be taken during recovery.
   10805                 :            :      */

   10813                 :            :      * During recovery, we don't need to check WAL level. Because, if WAL
   10814                 :            :      * level is not sufficient, it's impossible to get here during recovery.

   10823                 :            :     {

   10893 [ #  # ][ #  # ]:          0 :         PG_END_ENSURE_ERROR_CLEANUP(pg_stop_backup_callback, (Datum) BoolGetDatum(exclusive));
                 [ #  # ]
   10894                 :            :     }
   10895                 :            : 
   10896                 :            :     /*
   10897                 :            :      * OK to update backup counters, forcePageWrites and session-level lock.
   10898                 :            :      *
   10899                 :            :      * Note that CHECK_FOR_INTERRUPTS() must not occur while updating them.
   10900                 :            :      * Otherwise they can be updated inconsistently, and which might cause
   10901                 :            :      * do_pg_abort_backup() to fail.
   10902                 :            :      */
   10903                 :          0 :     WALInsertLockAcquireExclusive();
   10904         [ #  # ]:          0 :     if (exclusive)
   10905                 :            :     {
   10906                 :          0 :         XLogCtl->Insert.exclusiveBackupState = EXCLUSIVE_BACKUP_NONE;
   10907                 :            :     }
   10908                 :            :     else
   10909                 :            :     {
   10910                 :            :         /*
   10911                 :            :          * The user-visible pg_start/stop_backup() functions that operate on
   10912                 :            :          * exclusive backups can be called at any time, but for non-exclusive
   10913                 :            :          * backups, it is expected that each do_pg_start_backup() call is
   10914                 :            :          * matched by exactly one do_pg_stop_backup() call.
   10915                 :            :          */
   10916                 :            :         Assert(XLogCtl->Insert.nonExclusiveBackups > 0);
   10917                 :          0 :         XLogCtl->Insert.nonExclusiveBackups--;
   10918                 :            :     }
   10919                 :            : 
   10920 [ #  # ][ #  # ]:          0 :     if (XLogCtl->Insert.exclusiveBackupState == EXCLUSIVE_BACKUP_NONE &&
   10921                 :          0 :         XLogCtl->Insert.nonExclusiveBackups == 0)
   10922                 :            :     {
   10923                 :          0 :         XLogCtl->Insert.forcePageWrites = false;
   10924                 :            :     }
   10925                 :            : 
   10926                 :            :     /*
   10927                 :            :      * Clean up session-level lock.
   10928                 :            :      *
   10929                 :            :      * You might think that WALInsertLockRelease() can be called before
   10930                 :            :      * cleaning up session-level lock because session-level lock doesn't need
   10931                 :            :      * to be protected with WAL insertion lock. But since
   10932                 :            :      * CHECK_FOR_INTERRUPTS() can occur in it, session-level lock must be
   10933                 :            :      * cleaned up before it.
   10934                 :            :      */
   10935                 :          0 :     sessionBackupState = SESSION_BACKUP_NONE;
   10936                 :            : 
   10937                 :          0 :     WALInsertLockRelease();
   10938                 :            : 
   10939                 :            :     /*
   10940                 :            :      * Read and parse the START WAL LOCATION line (this code is pretty crude,
   10941                 :            :      * but we are not expecting any variability in the file format).
   10942                 :            :      */
   10943         [ #  # ]:          0 :     if (sscanf(labelfile, "START WAL LOCATION: %X/%X (file %24s)%c",
   10944                 :            :                &hi, &lo, startxlogfilename,
   10945         [ #  # ]:          0 :                &ch) != 4 || ch != '\n')
   10946         [ #  # ]:          0 :         ereport(ERROR,
   10947                 :            :                 (errcode(ERRCODE_OBJECT_NOT_IN_PREREQUISITE_STATE),
   10948                 :            :                  errmsg("invalid data in file \"%s\"", BACKUP_LABEL_FILE)));
   10949                 :          0 :     startpoint = ((uint64) hi) << 32 | lo;
   10950                 :          0 :     remaining = strchr(labelfile, '\n') + 1;    /* %n is not portable enough */
   10951                 :            : 
   10952                 :            :     /*
   10953                 :            :      * Parse the BACKUP FROM line. If we are taking an online backup from the
   10954                 :            :      * standby, we confirm that the standby has not been promoted during the
   10955                 :            :      * backup.
   10956                 :            :      */
   10957                 :          0 :     ptr = strstr(remaining, "BACKUP FROM:");
   10958 [ #  # ][ #  # ]:          0 :     if (!ptr || sscanf(ptr, "BACKUP FROM: %19s\n", backupfrom) != 1)
   10959         [ #  # ]:          0 :         ereport(ERROR,
   10960                 :            :                 (errcode(ERRCODE_OBJECT_NOT_IN_PREREQUISITE_STATE),
   10961                 :            :                  errmsg("invalid data in file \"%s\"", BACKUP_LABEL_FILE)));
   10962 [ #  # ][ #  # ]:          0 :     if (strcmp(backupfrom, "standby") == 0 && !backup_started_in_recovery)
   10963         [ #  # ]:          0 :         ereport(ERROR,
   10964                 :            :                 (errcode(ERRCODE_OBJECT_NOT_IN_PREREQUISITE_STATE),
   10965                 :            :                  errmsg("the standby was promoted during online backup"),
   10966                 :            :                  errhint("This means that the backup being taken is corrupt "
   10967                 :            :                          "and should not be used. "
   10968                 :            :                          "Try taking another online backup.")));
   10969                 :            : 
   10970                 :            :     /*
   10971                 :            :      * During recovery, we don't write an end-of-backup record. We assume that
   10972                 :            :      * pg_control was backed up last and its minimum recovery point can be
   10973                 :            :      * available as the backup end location. Since we don't have an
   10974                 :            :      * end-of-backup record, we use the pg_control value to check whether
   10975                 :            :      * we've reached the end of backup when starting recovery from this
   10976                 :            :      * backup. We have no way of checking if pg_control wasn't backed up last
   10977                 :            :      * however.
   10978                 :            :      *
   10979                 :            :      * We don't force a switch to new WAL file but it is still possible to
   10980                 :            :      * wait for all the required files to be archived if waitforarchive is
   10981                 :            :      * true. This is okay if we use the backup to start a standby and fetch
   10982                 :            :      * the missing WAL using streaming replication. But in the case of an
   10983                 :            :      * archive recovery, a user should set waitforarchive to true and wait for
   10984                 :            :      * them to be archived to ensure that all the required files are
   10985                 :            :      * available.
   10986                 :            :      *
   10987                 :            :      * We return the current minimum recovery point as the backup end
   10988                 :            :      * location. Note that it can be greater than the exact backup end
   10989                 :            :      * location if the minimum recovery point is updated after the backup of
   10990                 :            :      * pg_control. This is harmless for current uses.
   10991                 :            :      *
   10992                 :            :      * XXX currently a backup history file is for informational and debug
   10993                 :            :      * purposes only. It's not essential for an online backup. Furthermore,
   10994                 :            :      * even if it's created, it will not be archived during recovery because
   10995                 :            :      * an archiver is not invoked. So it doesn't seem worthwhile to write a
   10996                 :            :      * backup history file during recovery.
   10997                 :            :      */
   10998         [ #  # ]:          0 :     if (backup_started_in_recovery)
   10999                 :            :     {
   11000                 :            :         XLogRecPtr  recptr;
   11001                 :            : 
   11002                 :            :         /*
   11003                 :            :          * Check to see if all WAL replayed during online backup contain
   11004                 :            :          * full-page writes.
   11005                 :            :          */
   11006         [ #  # ]:          0 :         SpinLockAcquire(&XLogCtl->info_lck);
   11007                 :          0 :         recptr = XLogCtl->lastFpwDisableRecPtr;
   11008                 :          0 :         SpinLockRelease(&XLogCtl->info_lck);
   11009                 :            : 
   11010         [ #  # ]:          0 :         if (startpoint <= recptr)
   11011         [ #  # ]:          0 :             ereport(ERROR,
   11012                 :            :                     (errcode(ERRCODE_OBJECT_NOT_IN_PREREQUISITE_STATE),
   11013                 :            :                      errmsg("WAL generated with full_page_writes=off was replayed "
   11014                 :            :                             "during online backup"),
   11015                 :            :                      errhint("This means that the backup being taken on the standby "
   11016                 :            :                              "is corrupt and should not be used. "
   11017                 :            :                              "Enable full_page_writes and run CHECKPOINT on the master, "
   11018                 :            :                              "and then try an online backup again.")));
   11019                 :            : 
   11020                 :            : 
   11021                 :          0 :         LWLockAcquire(ControlFileLock, LW_SHARED);
   11022                 :          0 :         stoppoint = ControlFile->minRecoveryPoint;
   11023                 :          0 :         stoptli = ControlFile->minRecoveryPointTLI;
   11024                 :          0 :         LWLockRelease(ControlFileLock);
   11025                 :            :     }
   11026                 :            :     else
   11027                 :            :     {
   11028                 :            :         /*
   11029                 :            :          * Write the backup-end xlog record
   11030                 :            :          */
   11031                 :          0 :         XLogBeginInsert();
   11032                 :          0 :         XLogRegisterData((char *) (&startpoint), sizeof(startpoint));
   11033                 :          0 :         stoppoint = XLogInsert(RM_XLOG_ID, XLOG_BACKUP_END);
   11034                 :          0 :         stoptli = ThisTimeLineID;
   11035                 :            : 
   11036                 :            :         /*
   11037                 :            :          * Force a switch to a new xlog segment file, so that the backup is
   11038                 :            :          * valid as soon as archiver moves out the current segment file.
   11039                 :            :          */
   11040                 :          0 :         RequestXLogSwitch(false);
   11041                 :            : 
   11042                 :          0 :         XLByteToPrevSeg(stoppoint, _logSegNo, wal_segment_size);
   11043                 :          0 :         XLogFileName(stopxlogfilename, stoptli, _logSegNo, wal_segment_size);
   11044                 :            : 
   11045                 :            :         /* Use the log timezone here, not the session timezone */
   11046                 :          0 :         stamp_time = (pg_time_t) time(NULL);
   11047                 :          0 :         pg_strftime(strfbuf, sizeof(strfbuf),
   11048                 :            :                     "%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S %Z",
   11049                 :          0 :                     pg_localtime(&stamp_time, log_timezone));
   11050                 :            : 
   11051                 :            :         /*
   11052                 :            :          * Write the backup history file
   11053                 :            :          */
   11054                 :          0 :         XLByteToSeg(startpoint, _logSegNo, wal_segment_size);
   11055                 :          0 :         BackupHistoryFilePath(histfilepath, stoptli, _logSegNo,
   11056                 :            :                               startpoint, wal_segment_size);
   11057                 :          0 :         fp = AllocateFile(histfilepath, "w");
   11058         [ #  # ]:          0 :         if (!fp)
   11059         [ #  # ]:          0 :             ereport(ERROR,
   11060                 :            :                     (errcode_for_file_access(),
   11061                 :            :                      errmsg("could not create file \"%s\": %m",
   11062                 :            :                             histfilepath)));
   11063                 :          0 :         fprintf(fp, "START WAL LOCATION: %X/%X (file %s)\n",
   11064                 :          0 :                 (uint32) (startpoint >> 32), (uint32) startpoint, startxlogfilename);
   11065                 :          0 :         fprintf(fp, "STOP WAL LOCATION: %X/%X (file %s)\n",
   11066                 :          0 :                 (uint32) (stoppoint >> 32), (uint32) stoppoint, stopxlogfilename);
   11067                 :            : 
   11068                 :            :         /*
   11069                 :            :          * Transfer remaining lines including label and start timeline to
   11070                 :            :          * history file.
   11071                 :            :          */
   11072                 :          0 :         fprintf(fp, "%s", remaining);
   11073                 :          0 :         fprintf(fp, "STOP TIME: %s\n", strfbuf);
   11074                 :          0 :         fprintf(fp, "STOP TIMELINE: %u\n", stoptli);
   11075 [ #  # ][ #  # ]:          0 :         if (fflush(fp) || ferror(fp) || FreeFile(fp))

   11076         [ #  # ]:          0 :             ereport(ERROR,
   11077                 :            :                     (errcode_for_file_access(),
   11078                 :            :                      errmsg("could not write file \"%s\": %m",
   11079                 :            :                             histfilepath)));
   11080                 :            : 
   11081                 :            :         /*
   11082                 :            :          * Clean out any no-longer-needed history files.  As a side effect,
   11083                 :            :          * this will post a .ready file for the newly created history file,
   11084                 :            :          * notifying the archiver that history file may be archived
   11085                 :            :          * immediately.
   11086                 :            :          */
   11087                 :          0 :         CleanupBackupHistory();
   11088                 :            :     }
   11089                 :            : 
   11090                 :            :     /*
   11091                 :            :      * If archiving is enabled, wait for all the required WAL files to be
   11092                 :            :      * archived before returning. If archiving isn't enabled, the required WAL
   11093                 :            :      * needs to be transported via streaming replication (hopefully with
   11094                 :            :      * wal_keep_segments set high enough), or some more exotic mechanism like
   11095                 :            :      * polling and copying files from pg_wal with script. We have no knowledge
   11096                 :            :      * of those mechanisms, so it's up to the user to ensure that he gets all
   11097                 :            :      * the required WAL.
   11098                 :            :      *
   11099                 :            :      * We wait until both the last WAL file filled during backup and the
   11100                 :            :      * history file have been archived, and assume that the alphabetic sorting
   11101                 :            :      * property of the WAL files ensures any earlier WAL files are safely
   11102                 :            :      * archived as well.
   11103                 :            :      *
   11104                 :            :      * We wait forever, since archive_command is supposed to work and we
   11105                 :            :      * assume the admin wanted his backup to work completely. If you don't
   11106                 :            :      * wish to wait, then either waitforarchive should be passed in as false,
   11107                 :            :      * or you can set statement_timeout.  Also, some notices are issued to
   11108                 :            :      * clue in anyone who might be doing this interactively.
   11109                 :            :      */
   11110                 :            : 
   11111 [ #  # ][ #  # ]:          0 :     if (waitforarchive &&
   11112 [ #  # ][ #  # ]:          0 :         ((!backup_started_in_recovery && XLogArchivingActive()) ||
   11113         [ #  # ]:          0 :          (backup_started_in_recovery && XLogArchivingAlways())))
   11114                 :            :     {
   11115                 :          0 :         XLByteToPrevSeg(stoppoint, _logSegNo, wal_segment_size);
   11116                 :          0 :         XLogFileName(lastxlogfilename, stoptli, _logSegNo, wal_segment_size);
   11117                 :            : 
   11118                 :          0 :         XLByteToSeg(startpoint, _logSegNo, wal_segment_size);
   11119                 :          0 :         BackupHistoryFileName(histfilename, stoptli, _logSegNo,
   11120                 :            :                               startpoint, wal_segment_size);
   11121                 :            : 
   11122                 :          0 :         seconds_before_warning = 60;
   11123                 :          0 :         waits = 0;
   11124                 :            : 
   11125   [ #  #  #  # ]:          0 :         while (XLogArchiveIsBusy(lastxlogfilename) ||
   11126                 :          0 :                XLogArchiveIsBusy(histfilename))
   11127                 :            :         {
   11128         [ #  # ]:          0 :             CHECK_FOR_INTERRUPTS();
   11129                 :            : 
   11130 [ #  # ][ #  # ]:          0 :             if (!reported_waiting && waits > 5)
   11131                 :            :             {
   11132         [ #  # ]:          0 :                 ereport(NOTICE,
   11133                 :            :                         (errmsg("base backup done, waiting for required WAL segments to be archived")));
   11134                 :          0 :                 reported_waiting = true;
   11135                 :            :             }
   11136                 :            : 
   11137                 :          0 :             pg_usleep(1000000L);
   11138                 :            : 
   11139         [ #  # ]:          0 :             if (++waits >= seconds_before_warning)
   11140                 :            :             {
   11141                 :          0 :                 seconds_before_warning *= 2;    /* This wraps in >10 years... */
   11142         [ #  # ]:          0 :                 ereport(WARNING,
   11143                 :            :                         (errmsg("still waiting for all required WAL segments to be archived (%d seconds elapsed)",
   11144                 :            :                                 waits),
   11145                 :            :                          errhint("Check that your archive_command is executing properly.  "
   11146                 :            :                                  "You can safely cancel this backup, "
   11147                 :            :                                  "but the database backup will not be usable without all the WAL segments.")));
   11148                 :            :             }
   11149                 :            :         }
   11150                 :            : 
   11151         [ #  # ]:          0 :         ereport(NOTICE,
   11152                 :            :                 (errmsg("all required WAL segments have been archived")));
   11153                 :            :     }
   11154         [ #  # ]:          0 :     else if (waitforarchive)
   11155         [ #  # ]:          0 :         ereport(NOTICE,
   11156                 :            :                 (errmsg("WAL archiving is not enabled; you must ensure that all required WAL segments are copied through other means to complete the backup")));
   11157                 :            : 
   11158                 :            :     /*
   11159                 :            :      * We're done.  As a convenience, return the ending WAL location.
   11160                 :            :      */
   11161         [ #  # ]:          0 :     if (stoptli_p)
   11162                 :          0 :         *stoptli_p = stoptli;
   11163                 :          0 :     return stoppoint;
   11164                 :            : }
   11165                 :            : 
   11166                 :            : 
   11167                 :            : /*
   11168                 :            :  * do_pg_abort_backup: abort a running backup
   11169                 :            :  *
   11170                 :            :  * This does just the most basic steps of do_pg_stop_backup(), by taking the
   11171                 :            :  * system out of backup mode, thus making it a lot more safe to call from
   11172                 :            :  * an error handler.
   11173                 :            :  *
   11174                 :            :  * The caller can pass 'arg' as 'true' or 'false' to control whether a warning
   11175                 :            :  * is emitted.
   11176                 :            :  *
   11177                 :            :  * NB: This is only for aborting a non-exclusive backup that doesn't write
   11178                 :            :  * backup_label. A backup started with pg_start_backup() needs to be finished
   11179                 :            :  * with pg_stop_backup().
   11180                 :            :  *
   11181                 :            :  * NB: This gets used as a before_shmem_exit handler, hence the odd-looking
   11182                 :            :  * signature.
   11183                 :            :  */
   11184                 :            : void
   11185                 :          0 : do_pg_abort_backup(int code, Datum arg)
   11186                 :            : {
   11187                 :          0 :     bool    emit_warning = DatumGetBool(arg);
   11188                 :            : 
   11189                 :            :     /*
   11190                 :            :      * Quick exit if session is not keeping around a non-exclusive backup
   11191                 :            :      * already started.
   11192                 :            :      */
   11193         [ #  # ]:          0 :     if (sessionBackupState != SESSION_BACKUP_NON_EXCLUSIVE)
   11194                 :          0 :         return;
   11195                 :            : 
   11196                 :          0 :     WALInsertLockAcquireExclusive();
   11197                 :            :     Assert(XLogCtl->Insert.nonExclusiveBackups > 0);
   11198                 :          0 :     XLogCtl->Insert.nonExclusiveBackups--;
   11199                 :            : 
   11200 [ #  # ][ #  # ]:          0 :     if (XLogCtl->Insert.exclusiveBackupState == EXCLUSIVE_BACKUP_NONE &&
   11201                 :          0 :         XLogCtl->Insert.nonExclusiveBackups == 0)
   11202                 :            :     {
   11203                 :          0 :         XLogCtl->Insert.forcePageWrites = false;
   11204                 :            :     }
   11205                 :          0 :     WALInsertLockRelease();
   11206                 :            : 
   11207         [ #  # ]:          0 :     if (emit_warning)
   11208         [ #  # ]:          0 :         ereport(WARNING,
   11209                 :            :                 (errmsg("aborting backup due to backend exiting before pg_stop_backup was called")));
   11210                 :            : }
   11211                 :            : 
   11212                 :            : /*
   11213                 :            :  * Register a handler that will warn about unterminated backups at end of

   11216                 :            : void

   11219                 :            :     static bool already_done = false;
   11220                 :            : 
   11221         [ #  # ]:          0 :     if (already_done)
   11222                 :          0 :         return;
   11223                 :          0 :     before_shmem_exit(do_pg_abort_backup, DatumGetBool(true));

   11226                 :            : 
   11227                 :            : /*

   11248                 :            : /*

   11277                 :            : /*

   11279                 :            :  * the oldest point in WAL that we still need, if we have to restart recovery.
   11280                 :            :  */
   11281                 :            : void
   11282                 :          0 : GetOldestRestartPoint(XLogRecPtr *oldrecptr, TimeLineID *oldtli)
   11283                 :            : {
   11284                 :          0 :     LWLockAcquire(ControlFileLock, LW_SHARED);
   11285                 :          0 :     *oldrecptr = ControlFile->checkPointCopy.redo;
   11286                 :          0 :     *oldtli = ControlFile->checkPointCopy.ThisTimeLineID;
   11287                 :          0 :     LWLockRelease(ControlFileLock);
   11288                 :          0 : }
   11289                 :            : 
   11290                 :            : /*
   11291                 :            :  * read_backup_label: check to see if a backup_label file is present
   11292                 :            :  *
   11293                 :            :  * If we see a backup_label during recovery, we assume that we are recovering
   11294                 :            :  * from a backup dump file, and we therefore roll forward from the checkpoint
   11295                 :            :  * identified by the label file, NOT what pg_control says.  This avoids the
   11296                 :            :  * problem that pg_control might have been archived one or more checkpoints
   11297                 :            :  * later than the start of the dump, and so if we rely on it as the start
   11298                 :            :  * point, we will fail to restore a consistent database state.
   11299                 :            :  *
   11300                 :            :  * Returns true if a backup_label was found (and fills the checkpoint
   11301                 :            :  * location and its REDO location into *checkPointLoc and RedoStartLSN,
   11302                 :            :  * respectively); returns false if not. If this backup_label came from a
   11303                 :            :  * streamed backup, *backupEndRequired is set to true. If this backup_label
   11304                 :            :  * was created during recovery, *backupFromStandby is set to true.
   11305                 :            :  */
   11306                 :            : static bool
   11307                 :          1 : read_backup_label(XLogRecPtr *checkPointLoc, bool *backupEndRequired,
   11308                 :            :                   bool *backupFromStandby)
   11309                 :            : {
   11310                 :            :     char        startxlogfilename[MAXFNAMELEN];
   11311                 :            :     TimeLineID  tli_from_walseg,
   11312                 :            :                 tli_from_file;
   11313                 :            :     FILE       *lfp;
   11314                 :            :     char        ch;
   11315                 :            :     char        backuptype[20];
   11316                 :            :     char        backupfrom[20];
   11317                 :            :     char        backuplabel[MAXPGPATH];
   11318                 :            :     char        backuptime[128];
   11319                 :            :     uint32      hi,
   11320                 :            :                 lo;
   11321                 :            : 
   11322                 :          1 :     *backupEndRequired = false;
   11323                 :          1 :     *backupFromStandby = false;
   11324                 :            : 
   11325                 :            :     /*
   11326                 :            :      * See if label file is present
   11327                 :            :      */
   11328                 :          1 :     lfp = AllocateFile(BACKUP_LABEL_FILE, "r");
   11329         [ +  - ]:          1 :     if (!lfp)
   11330                 :            :     {
   11331         [ -  + ]:          1 :         if (errno != ENOENT)
   11332         [ #  # ]:          0 :             ereport(FATAL,
   11333                 :            :                     (errcode_for_file_access(),
   11334                 :            :                      errmsg("could not read file \"%s\": %m",
   11335                 :            :                             BACKUP_LABEL_FILE)));
   11336                 :          1 :         return false;           /* it's not there, all is fine */
   11337                 :            :     }
   11338                 :            : 
   11339                 :            :     /*
   11340                 :            :      * Read and parse the START WAL LOCATION and CHECKPOINT lines (this code
   11341                 :            :      * is pretty crude, but we are not expecting any variability in the file
   11342                 :            :      * format).

   11352         [ #  # ]:          0 :         ereport(FATAL,
   11353                 :            :                 (errcode(ERRCODE_OBJECT_NOT_IN_PREREQUISITE_STATE),
   11354                 :            :                  errmsg("invalid data in file \"%s\"", BACKUP_LABEL_FILE)));
   11355                 :          0 :     *checkPointLoc = ((uint64) hi) << 32 | lo;
   11356                 :            : 
   11357                 :            :     /*
   11358                 :            :      * BACKUP METHOD and BACKUP FROM lines are new in 9.2. We can't restore
   11359                 :            :      * from an older backup anyway, but since the information on it is not
   11360                 :            :      * strictly required, don't error out if it's missing for some reason.
   11361                 :            :      */
   11362         [ #  # ]:          0 :     if (fscanf(lfp, "BACKUP METHOD: %19s\n", backuptype) == 1)
   11363                 :            :     {
   11364         [ #  # ]:          0 :         if (strcmp(backuptype, "streamed") == 0)
   11365                 :          0 :             *backupEndRequired = true;
   11366                 :            :     }
   11367                 :            : 
   11368         [ #  # ]:          0 :     if (fscanf(lfp, "BACKUP FROM: %19s\n", backupfrom) == 1)
   11369                 :            :     {
   11370         [ #  # ]:          0 :         if (strcmp(backupfrom, "standby") == 0)
   11371                 :          0 :             *backupFromStandby = true;
   11372                 :            :     }
   11373                 :            : 
   11374                 :            :     /*
   11375                 :            :      * Parse START TIME and LABEL. Those are not mandatory fields for recovery
   11376                 :            :      * but checking for their presence is useful for debugging and the next
   11377                 :            :      * sanity checks. Cope also with the fact that the result buffers have a
   11378                 :            :      * pre-allocated size, hence if the backup_label file has been generated
   11379                 :            :      * with strings longer than the maximum assumed here an incorrect parsing
   11380                 :            :      * happens. That's fine as only minor consistency checks are done
   11381                 :            :      * afterwards.
   11382                 :            :      */
   11383         [ #  # ]:          0 :     if (fscanf(lfp, "START TIME: %127[^\n]\n", backuptime) == 1)
   11384         [ #  # ]:          0 :         ereport(DEBUG1,
   11385                 :            :                 (errmsg("backup time %s in file \"%s\"",
   11386                 :            :                         backuptime, BACKUP_LABEL_FILE)));
   11387                 :            : 
   11388         [ #  # ]:          0 :     if (fscanf(lfp, "LABEL: %1023[^\n]\n", backuplabel) == 1)
   11389         [ #  # ]:          0 :         ereport(DEBUG1,
   11390                 :            :                 (errmsg("backup label %s in file \"%s\"",
   11391                 :            :                         backuplabel, BACKUP_LABEL_FILE)));
   11392                 :            : 
   11393                 :            :     /*
   11394                 :            :      * START TIMELINE is new as of 11. Its parsing is not mandatory, still use
   11395                 :            :      * it as a sanity check if present.
   11396                 :            :      */
   11397         [ #  # ]:          0 :     if (fscanf(lfp, "START TIMELINE: %u\n", &tli_from_file) == 1)
   11398                 :            :     {
   11399         [ #  # ]:          0 :         if (tli_from_walseg != tli_from_file)
   11400         [ #  # ]:          0 :             ereport(FATAL,

   11403                 :            :                      errdetail("Timeline ID parsed is %u, but expected %u.",

   11407                 :            :                 (errmsg("backup timeline %u in file \"%s\"",

   11409                 :            :     }
   11410                 :            : 
   11411 [ #  # ][ #  # ]:          0 :     if (ferror(lfp) || FreeFile(lfp))
   11412         [ #  # ]:          0 :         ereport(FATAL,
   11413                 :            :                 (errcode_for_file_access(),
   11414                 :            :                  errmsg("could not read file \"%s\": %m",
   11415                 :            :                         BACKUP_LABEL_FILE)));
   11416                 :            :
