   11419                 :            : 
   11420                 :            : /*
   11421                 :            :  * read_tablespace_map: check to see if a tablespace_map file is present
   11422                 :            :  *
   11423                 :            :  * If we see a tablespace_map file during recovery, we assume that we are
   11424                 :            :  * recovering from a backup dump file, and we therefore need to create symlinks
   11425                 :            :  * as per the information present in tablespace_map file.
   11426                 :            :  *
   11427                 :            :  * Returns true if a tablespace_map file was found (and fills the link
   11428                 :            :  * information for all the tablespace links present in file); returns false
   11429                 :            :  * if not.
   11430                 :            :  */
   11431                 :            : static bool
   11432                 :          0 : read_tablespace_map(List **tablespaces)
   11433                 :            : {
   11434                 :            :     tablespaceinfo *ti;
   11435                 :            :     FILE       *lfp;
   11436                 :            :     char        tbsoid[MAXPGPATH];
   11437                 :            :     char       *tbslinkpath;
   11438                 :            :     char        str[MAXPGPATH];
   11439                 :            :     int         ch,
   11440                 :          0 :                 prev_ch = -1,
   11441                 :          0 :                 i = 0,
   11442                 :            :                 n;
   11443                 :            : 
   11444                 :            :     /*
   11445                 :            :      * See if tablespace_map file is present
   11446                 :            :      */
   11447                 :          0 :     lfp = AllocateFile(TABLESPACE_MAP, "r");
   11448         [ #  # ]:          0 :     if (!lfp)
   11449                 :            :     {
   11450         [ #  # ]:          0 :         if (errno != ENOENT)
   11451         [ #  # ]:          0 :             ereport(FATAL,
   11452                 :            :                     (errcode_for_file_access(),
   11453                 :            :                      errmsg("could not read file \"%s\": %m",
   11454                 :            :                             TABLESPACE_MAP)));
   11455                 :          0 :         return false;           /* it's not there, all is fine */
   11456                 :            :     }
   11457                 :            : 
   11458                 :            :     /*
   11459                 :            :      * Read and parse the link name and path lines from tablespace_map file
   11460                 :            :      * (this code is pretty crude, but we are not expecting any variability in
   11461                 :            :      * the file format).  While taking backup we embed escape character '\\'
   11462                 :            :      * before newline in tablespace path, so that during reading of
   11463                 :            :      * tablespace_map file, we could distinguish newline in tablespace path
   11464                 :            :      * and end of line.  Now while reading tablespace_map file, remove the
   11465                 :            :      * escape character that has been added in tablespace path during backup.
   11466                 :            :      */
   11467         [ #  # ]:          0 :     while ((ch = fgetc(lfp)) != EOF)
   11468                 :            :     {
   11469 [ #  # ][ #  # ]:          0 :         if ((ch == '\n' || ch == '\r') && prev_ch != '\\')
                 [ #  # ]
   11470                 :            :         {
   11471                 :          0 :             str[i] = '\0';
   11472         [ #  # ]:          0 :             if (sscanf(str, "%s %n", tbsoid, &n) != 1)
   11473         [ #  # ]:          0 :                 ereport(FATAL,
   11474                 :            :                         (errcode(ERRCODE_OBJECT_NOT_IN_PREREQUISITE_STATE),
   11475                 :            :                          errmsg("invalid data in file \"%s\"", TABLESPACE_MAP)));
   11476                 :          0 :             tbslinkpath = str + n;
   11477                 :          0 :             i = 0;
   11478                 :            : 
   11479                 :          0 :             ti = palloc(sizeof(tablespaceinfo));
   11480                 :          0 :             ti->oid = pstrdup(tbsoid);
   11481                 :          0 :             ti->path = pstrdup(tbslinkpath);
   11482                 :            : 
   11483                 :          0 :             *tablespaces = lappend(*tablespaces, ti);
   11484                 :          0 :             continue;
   11485                 :            :         }
   11486 [ #  # ][ #  # ]:          0 :         else if ((ch == '\n' || ch == '\r') && prev_ch == '\\')
                 [ #  # ]
   11487                 :          0 :             str[i - 1] = ch;
   11488         [ #  # ]:          0 :         else if (i < sizeof(str) - 1)
   11489                 :          0 :             str[i++] = ch;
   11490                 :          0 :         prev_ch = ch;
   11491                 :            :     }
   11492                 :            : 
   11493 [ #  # ][ #  # ]:          0 :     if (ferror(lfp) || FreeFile(lfp))
   11494         [ #  # ]:          0 :         ereport(FATAL,
   11495                 :            :                 (errcode_for_file_access(),
   11496                 :            :                  errmsg("could not read file \"%s\": %m",
   11497                 :            :                         TABLESPACE_MAP)));
   11498                 :            : 
   11499                 :          0 :     return true;
   11500                 :            : }
   11501                 :            : 
   11502                 :            : /*
   11503                 :            :  * Error context callback for errors occurring during rm_redo().
   11504                 :            :  */
   11505                 :            : static void
   11506                 :          0 : rm_redo_error_callback(void *arg)
   11507                 :            : {
   11508                 :          0 :     XLogReaderState *record = (XLogReaderState *) arg;
   11509                 :            :     StringInfoData buf;
   11510                 :            : 
   11511                 :          0 :     initStringInfo(&buf);
   11512                 :          0 :     xlog_outdesc(&buf, record);
   11513                 :            : 
   11514                 :            :     /* translator: %s is a WAL record description */
   11515                 :          0 :     errcontext("WAL redo at %X/%X for %s",
   11516                 :          0 :                (uint32) (record->ReadRecPtr >> 32),
   11517                 :          0 :                (uint32) record->ReadRecPtr,
   11518                 :            :                buf.data);
   11519                 :            : 
   11520                 :          0 :     pfree(buf.data);
   11521                 :          0 : }
   11522                 :            : 
   11523                 :            : /*
   11524                 :            :  * BackupInProgress: check if online backup mode is active
   11525                 :            :  *
   11526                 :            :  * This is done by checking for existence of the "backup_label" file.
   11527                 :            :  */
   11528                 :            : bool
   11529                 :          0 : BackupInProgress(void)
   11530                 :            : {
   11531                 :            :     struct stat stat_buf;
   11532                 :            : 
   11533                 :          0 :     return (stat(BACKUP_LABEL_FILE, &stat_buf) == 0);
   11534                 :            : }
   11535                 :            : 
   11536                 :            : /*
   11537                 :            :  * CancelBackup: rename the "backup_label" and "tablespace_map"
   11538                 :            :  *               files to cancel backup mode
   11539                 :            :  *
   11540                 :            :  * If the "backup_label" file exists, it will be renamed to "backup_label.old".
   11541                 :            :  * Similarly, if the "tablespace_map" file exists, it will be renamed to
   11542                 :            :  * "tablespace_map.old".
   11543                 :            :  *
   11544                 :            :  * Note that this will render an online backup in progress
   11545                 :            :  * useless. To correctly finish an online backup, pg_stop_backup must be
   11546                 :            :  * called.
   11547                 :            :  */
   11548                 :            : void
   11549                 :          1 : CancelBackup(void)
   11550                 :            : {
   11551                 :            :     struct stat stat_buf;
   11552                 :            : 
   11553                 :            :     /* if the backup_label file is not there, return */
   11554         [ +  - ]:          1 :     if (stat(BACKUP_LABEL_FILE, &stat_buf) < 0)
   11555                 :          1 :         return;
   11556                 :            : 
   11557                 :            :     /* remove leftover file from previously canceled backup if it exists */
   11558                 :          0 :     unlink(BACKUP_LABEL_OLD);
   11559                 :            : 
   11560         [ #  # ]:          0 :     if (durable_rename(BACKUP_LABEL_FILE, BACKUP_LABEL_OLD, DEBUG1) != 0)
   11561                 :            :     {
   11562         [ #  # ]:          0 :         ereport(WARNING,
   11563                 :            :                 (errcode_for_file_access(),
   11564                 :            :                  errmsg("online backup mode was not canceled"),
   11565                 :            :                  errdetail("File \"%s\" could not be renamed to \"%s\": %m.",
   11566                 :            :                            BACKUP_LABEL_FILE, BACKUP_LABEL_OLD)));
   11567                 :          0 :         return;
   11568                 :            :     }
   11569                 :            : 
   11570                 :            :     /* if the tablespace_map file is not there, return */
   11571         [ #  # ]:          0 :     if (stat(TABLESPACE_MAP, &stat_buf) < 0)
   11572                 :            :     {
   11573         [ #  # ]:          0 :         ereport(LOG,
   11574                 :            :                 (errmsg("online backup mode canceled"),
   11575                 :            :                  errdetail("File \"%s\" was renamed to \"%s\".",
   11576                 :            :                            BACKUP_LABEL_FILE, BACKUP_LABEL_OLD)));
   11577                 :          0 :         return;
   11578                 :            :     }
   11579                 :            : 
   11580                 :            :     /* remove leftover file from previously canceled backup if it exists */
   11581                 :          0 :     unlink(TABLESPACE_MAP_OLD);
   11582                 :            : 
   11583         [ #  # ]:          0 :     if (durable_rename(TABLESPACE_MAP, TABLESPACE_MAP_OLD, DEBUG1) == 0)
   11584                 :            :     {
   11585         [ #  # ]:          0 :         ereport(LOG,
   11586                 :            :                 (errmsg("online backup mode canceled"),
   11587                 :            :                  errdetail("Files \"%s\" and \"%s\" were renamed to "
   11588                 :            :                            "\"%s\" and \"%s\", respectively.",
   11589                 :            :                            BACKUP_LABEL_FILE, TABLESPACE_MAP,
   11590                 :            :                            BACKUP_LABEL_OLD, TABLESPACE_MAP_OLD)));
   11591                 :            :     }
   11592                 :            :     else
   11593                 :            :     {
   11594         [ #  # ]:          0 :         ereport(WARNING,
   11595                 :            :                 (errcode_for_file_access(),
   11596                 :            :                  errmsg("online backup mode canceled"),
   11597                 :            :                  errdetail("File \"%s\" was renamed to \"%s\", but "
   11598                 :            :                            "file \"%s\" could not be renamed to \"%s\": %m.",
   11599                 :            :                            BACKUP_LABEL_FILE, BACKUP_LABEL_OLD,
   11600                 :            :                            TABLESPACE_MAP, TABLESPACE_MAP_OLD)));
   11601                 :            :     }
   11602                 :            : }
   11603                 :            : 
   11604                 :            : /*
   11605                 :            :  * Read the XLOG page containing RecPtr into readBuf (if not read already).
   11606                 :            :  * Returns number of bytes read, if the page is read successfully, or -1
   11607                 :            :  * in case of errors.  When errors occur, they are ereport'ed, but only
   11608                 :            :  * if they have not been previously reported.
   11609                 :            :  *
   11610                 :            :  * This is responsible for restoring files from archive as needed, as well
   11611                 :            :  * as for waiting for the requested WAL record to arrive in standby mode.
   11612                 :            :  *
   11613                 :            :  * 'emode' specifies the log level used for reporting "file not found" or
   11614                 :            :  * "end of WAL" situations in archive recovery, or in standby mode when a
   11615                 :            :  * trigger file is found. If set to WARNING or below, XLogPageRead() returns
   11616                 :            :  * false in those situations, on higher log levels the ereport() won't
   11617                 :            :  * return.
   11618                 :            :  *
   11619                 :            :  * In standby mode, if after a successful return of XLogPageRead() the
   11620                 :            :  * caller finds the record it's interested in to be broken, it should
   11621                 :            :  * ereport the error with the level determined by
   11622                 :            :  * emode_for_corrupt_record(), and then set lastSourceFailed
   11623                 :            :  * and call XLogPageRead() again with the same arguments. This lets
   11624                 :            :  * XLogPageRead() to try fetching the record from another source, or to
   11625                 :            :  * sleep and retry.
   11626                 :            :  */
   11627                 :            : static int
   11628                 :          1 : XLogPageRead(XLogReaderState *xlogreader, XLogRecPtr targetPagePtr, int reqLen,
   11629                 :            :              XLogRecPtr targetRecPtr, char *readBuf, TimeLineID *readTLI)
   11630                 :            : {
   11631                 :          1 :     XLogPageReadPrivate *private =
   11632                 :            :     (XLogPageReadPrivate *) xlogreader->private_data;
   11633                 :          1 :     int         emode = private->emode;
   11634                 :            :     uint32      targetPageOff;
   11635                 :            :     XLogSegNo   targetSegNo PG_USED_FOR_ASSERTS_ONLY;
   11636                 :            :     int         r;
   11637                 :            : 
   11638                 :          1 :     XLByteToSeg(targetPagePtr, targetSegNo, wal_segment_size);
   11639                 :          1 :     targetPageOff = XLogSegmentOffset(targetPagePtr, wal_segment_size);
   11640                 :            : 
   11641                 :            :     /*
   11642                 :            :      * See if we need to switch to a new segment because the requested record
   11643                 :            :      * is not in the currently open one.
   11644                 :            :      */
   11645 [ -  + ][ #  # ]:          1 :     if (readFile >= 0 &&
   11646                 :          0 :         !XLByteInSeg(targetPagePtr, readSegNo, wal_segment_size))
   11647                 :            :     {
   11648                 :            :         /*
   11649                 :            :          * Request a restartpoint if we've replayed too much xlog since the
   11650                 :            :          * last one.
   11651                 :            :          */
   11652         [ #  # ]:          0 :         if (bgwriterLaunched)
   11653                 :            :         {
   11654         [ #  # ]:          0 :             if (XLogCheckpointNeeded(readSegNo))
   11655                 :            :             {
   11656                 :          0 :                 (void) GetRedoRecPtr();
   11657         [ #  # ]:          0 :                 if (XLogCheckpointNeeded(readSegNo))
   11658                 :          0 :                     RequestCheckpoint(CHECKPOINT_CAUSE_XLOG);
   11659                 :            :             }
   11660                 :            :         }
   11661                 :            : 
   11662                 :          0 :         close(readFile);
   11663                 :          0 :         readFile = -1;
   11664                 :          0 :         readSource = 0;
   11665                 :            :     }
   11666                 :            : 
   11667                 :          1 :     XLByteToSeg(targetPagePtr, readSegNo, wal_segment_size);
   11668                 :            : 
   11669                 :            : retry:
   11670                 :            :     /* See if we need to retrieve more data */
   11671 [ -  + ][ #  # ]:          1 :     if (readFile < 0 ||
   11672         [ #  # ]:          0 :         (readSource == XLOG_FROM_STREAM &&
   11673                 :          0 :          receivedUpto < targetPagePtr + reqLen))
   11674                 :            :     {
   11675         [ -  + ]:          1 :         if (!WaitForWALToBecomeAvailable(targetPagePtr + reqLen,
   11676                 :          1 :                                          private->randAccess,
   11677                 :          1 :                                          private->fetching_ckpt,
   11678                 :            :                                          targetRecPtr))
   11679                 :            :         {
   11680         [ #  # ]:          0 :             if (readFile >= 0)
   11681                 :          0 :                 close(readFile);
   11682                 :          0 :             readFile = -1;
   11683                 :          0 :             readLen = 0;
   11684                 :          0 :             readSource = 0;
   11685                 :            : 
   11686                 :          0 :             return -1;
   11687                 :            :         }
   11688                 :            :     }
   11689                 :            : 
   11690                 :            :     /*
   11691                 :            :      * At this point, we have the right segment open and if we're streaming we
   11692                 :            :      * know the requested record is in it.
   11693                 :            :      */
   11694                 :            :     Assert(readFile != -1);
   11695                 :            : 
   11696                 :            :     /*
   11697                 :            :      * If the current segment is being streamed from master, calculate how
   11698                 :            :      * much of the current page we have received already. We know the
   11699                 :            :      * requested record has been received, but this is for the benefit of
   11700                 :            :      * future calls, to allow quick exit at the top of this function.
   11701                 :            :      */
   11702         [ -  + ]:          1 :     if (readSource == XLOG_FROM_STREAM)
   11703                 :            :     {
   11704         [ #  # ]:          0 :         if (((targetPagePtr) / XLOG_BLCKSZ) != (receivedUpto / XLOG_BLCKSZ))
   11705                 :          0 :             readLen = XLOG_BLCKSZ;
   11706                 :            :         else
   11707                 :          0 :             readLen = XLogSegmentOffset(receivedUpto, wal_segment_size) -
   11708                 :            :                 targetPageOff;
   11709                 :            :     }
   11710                 :            :     else
   11711                 :          1 :         readLen = XLOG_BLCKSZ;
   11712                 :            : 
   11713                 :            :     /* Read the requested page */
   11714                 :          1 :     readOff = targetPageOff;
   11715                 :            : 
   11716                 :          1 :     pgstat_report_wait_start(WAIT_EVENT_WAL_READ);
   11717                 :          1 :     r = pg_pread(readFile, readBuf, XLOG_BLCKSZ, (off_t) readOff);
   11718         [ -  + ]:          1 :     if (r != XLOG_BLCKSZ)
   11719                 :            :     {
   11720                 :            :         char        fname[MAXFNAMELEN];
   11721                 :          0 :         int         save_errno = errno;
   11722                 :            : 
   11723                 :          0 :         pgstat_report_wait_end();
   11724                 :          0 :         XLogFileName(fname, curFileTLI, readSegNo, wal_segment_size);
   11725         [ #  # ]:          0 :         if (r < 0)
   11726                 :            :         {
   11727                 :          0 :             errno = save_errno;
   11728         [ #  # ]:          0 :             ereport(emode_for_corrupt_record(emode, targetPagePtr + reqLen),
   11729                 :            :                     (errcode_for_file_access(),
   11730                 :            :                      errmsg("could not read from log segment %s, offset %u: %m",
   11731                 :            :                             fname, readOff)));
   11732                 :            :         }
   11733                 :            :         else
   11734         [ #  # ]:          0 :             ereport(emode_for_corrupt_record(emode, targetPagePtr + reqLen),
   11735                 :            :                     (errcode(ERRCODE_DATA_CORRUPTED),
   11736                 :            :                      errmsg("could not read from log segment %s, offset %u: read %d of %zu",
   11737                 :            :                             fname, readOff, r, (Size) XLOG_BLCKSZ)));
   11738                 :          0 :         goto next_record_is_invalid;
   11739                 :            :     }
   11740                 :          1 :     pgstat_report_wait_end();
   11741                 :            : 
   11742                 :            :     Assert(targetSegNo == readSegNo);
   11743                 :            :     Assert(targetPageOff == readOff);
   11744                 :            :     Assert(reqLen <= readLen);
   11745                 :            : 
   11746                 :          1 :     *readTLI = curFileTLI;
   11747                 :            : 
   11748                 :            :     /*
   11749                 :            :      * Check the page header immediately, so that we can retry immediately if
   11750                 :            :      * it's not valid. This may seem unnecessary, because XLogReadRecord()
   11751                 :            :      * validates the page header anyway, and would propagate the failure up to
   11752                 :            :      * ReadRecord(), which would retry. However, there's a corner case with
   11753                 :            :      * continuation records, if a record is split across two pages such that
   11754                 :            :      * we would need to read the two pages from different sources. For
   11755                 :            :      * example, imagine a scenario where a streaming replica is started up,
   11756                 :            :      * and replay reaches a record that's split across two WAL segments. The
   11757                 :            :      * first page is only available locally, in pg_wal, because it's already
   11758                 :            :      * been recycled in the master. The second page, however, is not present
   11759                 :            :      * in pg_wal, and we should stream it from the master. There is a recycled
   11760                 :            :      * WAL segment present in pg_wal, with garbage contents, however. We would
   11761                 :            :      * read the first page from the local WAL segment, but when reading the
   11762                 :            :      * second page, we would read the bogus, recycled, WAL segment. If we
   11763                 :            :      * didn't catch that case here, we would never recover, because
   11764                 :            :      * ReadRecord() would retry reading the whole record from the beginning.
   11765                 :            :      *
   11766                 :            :      * Of course, this only catches errors in the page header, which is what
   11767                 :            :      * happens in the case of a recycled WAL segment. Other kinds of errors or
   11768                 :            :      * corruption still has the same problem. But this at least fixes the
   11769                 :            :      * common case, which can happen as part of normal operation.
   11770                 :            :      *
   11771                 :            :      * Validating the page header is cheap enough that doing it twice
   11772                 :            :      * shouldn't be a big deal from a performance point of view.
   11773                 :            :      */
   11774         [ -  + ]:          1 :     if (!XLogReaderValidatePageHeader(xlogreader, targetPagePtr, readBuf))
   11775                 :            :     {
   11776                 :            :         /* reset any error XLogReaderValidatePageHeader() might have set */
   11777                 :          0 :         xlogreader->errormsg_buf[0] = '\0';
   11778                 :          0 :         goto next_record_is_invalid;
   11779                 :            :     }
   11780                 :            : 
   11781                 :          1 :     return readLen;
   11782                 :            : 
   11783                 :            : next_record_is_invalid:
   11784                 :          0 :     lastSourceFailed = true;
   11785                 :            : 
   11786         [ #  # ]:          0 :     if (readFile >= 0)
   11787                 :          0 :         close(readFile);
   11788                 :          0 :     readFile = -1;
   11789                 :          0 :     readLen = 0;
   11790                 :          0 :     readSource = 0;
   11791                 :            : 
   11792                 :            :     /* In standby-mode, keep trying */
   11793         [ #  # ]:          0 :     if (StandbyMode)
   11794                 :          0 :         goto retry;
   11795                 :            :     else
   11796                 :          0 :         return -1;
   11797                 :            : }
   11798                 :            : 
   11799                 :            : /*
   11800                 :            :  * Open the WAL segment containing WAL location 'RecPtr'.
   11801                 :            :  *
   11802                 :            :  * The segment can be fetched via restore_command, or via walreceiver having
   11803                 :            :  * streamed the record, or it can already be present in pg_wal. Checking
   11804                 :            :  * pg_wal is mainly for crash recovery, but it will be polled in standby mode
   11805                 :            :  * too, in case someone copies a new segment directly to pg_wal. That is not
   11806                 :            :  * documented or recommended, though.
   11807                 :            :  *
   11808                 :            :  * If 'fetching_ckpt' is true, we're fetching a checkpoint record, and should
   11809                 :            :  * prepare to read WAL starting from RedoStartLSN after this.
   11810                 :            :  *
   11811                 :            :  * 'RecPtr' might not point to the beginning of the record we're interested
   11812                 :            :  * in, it might also point to the page or segment header. In that case,
   11813                 :            :  * 'tliRecPtr' is the position of the WAL record we're interested in. It is
   11814                 :            :  * used to decide which timeline to stream the requested WAL from.
   11815                 :            :  *
   11816                 :            :  * If the record is not immediately available, the function returns false
   11817                 :            :  * if we're not in standby mode. In standby mode, waits for it to become
   11818                 :            :  * available.
   11819                 :            :  *
   11820                 :            :  * When the requested record becomes available, the function opens the file
   11821                 :            :  * containing it (if not open already), and returns true. When end of standby
   11822                 :            :  * mode is triggered by the user, and there is no more WAL available, returns
   11823                 :            :  * false.
   11824                 :            :  */
   11825                 :            : static bool
   11826                 :          1 : WaitForWALToBecomeAvailable(XLogRecPtr RecPtr, bool randAccess,
   11827                 :            :                             bool fetching_ckpt, XLogRecPtr tliRecPtr)
   11828                 :            : {
   11829                 :            :     static TimestampTz last_fail_time = 0;
   11830                 :            :     TimestampTz now;
   11831                 :          1 :     bool        streaming_reply_sent = false;
   11832                 :            : 
   11833                 :            :     /*-------
   11834                 :            :      * Standby mode is implemented by a state machine:
   11835                 :            :      *
   11836                 :            :      * 1. Read from either archive or pg_wal (XLOG_FROM_ARCHIVE), or just
   11837                 :            :      *    pg_wal (XLOG_FROM_PG_WAL)
   11838                 :            :      * 2. Check trigger file
   11839                 :            :      * 3. Read from primary server via walreceiver (XLOG_FROM_STREAM)
   11840                 :            :      * 4. Rescan timelines
   11841                 :            :      * 5. Sleep wal_retrieve_retry_interval milliseconds, and loop back to 1.
   11842                 :            :      *
   11843                 :            :      * Failure to read from the current source advances the state machine to
   11844                 :            :      * the next state.
   11845                 :            :      *
   11846                 :            :      * 'currentSource' indicates the current state. There are no currentSource
   11847                 :            :      * values for "check trigger", "rescan timelines", and "sleep" states,
   11848                 :            :      * those actions are taken when reading from the previous source fails, as
   11849                 :            :      * part of advancing to the next state.
   11850                 :            :      *
   11851                 :            :      * If standby mode is turned off while reading WAL from stream, we move
   11852                 :            :      * to XLOG_FROM_ARCHIVE and reset lastSourceFailed, to force fetching
   11853                 :            :      * the files (which would be required at end of recovery, e.g., timeline
   11854                 :            :      * history file) from archive or pg_wal. We don't need to kill WAL receiver
   11855                 :            :      * here because it's already stopped when standby mode is turned off at
   11856                 :            :      * the end of recovery.
   11857                 :            :      *-------
   11858                 :            :      */
   11859         [ +  - ]:          1 :     if (!InArchiveRecovery)
   11860                 :          1 :         currentSource = XLOG_FROM_PG_WAL;
   11861 [ #  # ][ #  # ]:          0 :     else if (currentSource == 0 ||
   11862         [ #  # ]:          0 :              (!StandbyMode && currentSource == XLOG_FROM_STREAM))
   11863                 :            :     {
   11864                 :          0 :         lastSourceFailed = false;
   11865                 :          0 :         currentSource = XLOG_FROM_ARCHIVE;
   11866                 :            :     }
   11867                 :            : 
   11868                 :            :     for (;;)
   11869                 :            :     {
   11870                 :          1 :         int         oldSource = currentSource;
   11871                 :            : 
   11872                 :            :         /*
   11873                 :            :          * First check if we failed to read from the current source, and
   11874                 :            :          * advance the state machine if so. The failure to read might've
   11875                 :            :          * happened outside this function, e.g when a CRC check fails on a
   11876                 :            :          * record, or within this loop.
   11877                 :            :          */
   11878         [ -  + ]:          1 :         if (lastSourceFailed)
   11879                 :            :         {
   11880      [ #  #  # ]:          0 :             switch (currentSource)
   11881                 :            :             {
   11882                 :            :                 case XLOG_FROM_ARCHIVE:
   11883                 :            :                 case XLOG_FROM_PG_WAL:
   11884                 :            : 
   11885                 :            :                     /*
   11886                 :            :                      * Check to see if the trigger file exists. Note that we
   11887                 :            :                      * do this only after failure, so when you create the
   11888                 :            :                      * trigger file, we still finish replaying as much as we
   11889                 :            :                      * can from archive and pg_wal before failover.
   11890                 :            :                      */
   11891 [ #  # ][ #  # ]:          0 :                     if (StandbyMode && CheckForStandbyTrigger())
   11892                 :            :                     {
   11893                 :          0 :                         ShutdownWalRcv();
   11894                 :          0 :                         return false;
   11895                 :            :                     }
   11896                 :            : 
   11897                 :            :                     /*
   11898                 :            :                      * Not in standby mode, and we've now tried the archive
   11899                 :            :                      * and pg_wal.
   11900                 :            :                      */
   11901         [ #  # ]:          0 :                     if (!StandbyMode)
   11902                 :          0 :                         return false;
   11903                 :            : 
   11904                 :            :                     /*
   11905                 :            :                      * If primary_conninfo is set, launch walreceiver to try
   11906                 :            :                      * to stream the missing WAL.
   11907                 :            :                      *
   11908                 :            :                      * If fetching_ckpt is true, RecPtr points to the initial
   11909                 :            :                      * checkpoint location. In that case, we use RedoStartLSN
   11910                 :            :                      * as the streaming start position instead of RecPtr, so
   11911                 :            :                      * that when we later jump backwards to start redo at
   11912                 :            :                      * RedoStartLSN, we will have the logs streamed already.
   11913                 :            :                      */
   11914 [ #  # ][ #  # ]:          0 :                     if (PrimaryConnInfo && strcmp(PrimaryConnInfo, "") != 0)
   11915                 :            :                     {
   11916                 :            :                         XLogRecPtr  ptr;
   11917                 :            :                         TimeLineID  tli;
   11918                 :            : 
   11919         [ #  # ]:          0 :                         if (fetching_ckpt)

   11921                 :          0 :                             ptr = RedoStartLSN;
   11922                 :          0 :                             tli = ControlFile->checkPointCopy.ThisTimeLineID;
   11923                 :            :                         }
   11924                 :            :                         else
   11925                 :            :                         {
   11926                 :          0 :                             ptr = RecPtr;
   11927                 :            : 
   11928                 :            :                             /*
   11929                 :            :                              * Use the record begin position to determine the
   11930                 :            :                              * TLI, rather than the position we're reading.
   11931                 :            :                              */
   11932                 :          0 :                             tli = tliOfPointInHistory(tliRecPtr, expectedTLEs);

   11934 [ #  # ][ #  # ]:          0 :                             if (curFileTLI > 0 && tli < curFileTLI)
   11935                 :          0 :                                 elog(ERROR, "according to history file, WAL location %X/%X belongs to timeline %u, but previous recovered WAL file came from timeline %u",

   11937                 :            :                                      (uint32) tliRecPtr,
   11938                 :            :                                      tli, curFileTLI);
   11939                 :            :                         }
   11940                 :          0 :                         curFileTLI = tli;
   11941                 :          0 :                         RequestXLogStreaming(tli, ptr, PrimaryConnInfo,
   11942                 :            :                                              PrimarySlotName);
   11943                 :          0 :                         receivedUpto = 0;
   11944                 :            :                     }
   11945                 :            : 
   11946                 :            :                     /*
   11947                 :            :                      * Move to XLOG_FROM_STREAM state in either case. We'll
   11948                 :            :                      * get immediate failure if we didn't launch walreceiver,
   11949                 :            :                      * and move on to the next state.
   11950                 :            :                      */
   11951                 :          0 :                     currentSource = XLOG_FROM_STREAM;
   11952                 :          0 :                     break;
   11953                 :            : 
   11954                 :            :                 case XLOG_FROM_STREAM:
   11955                 :            : 
   11956                 :            :                     /*
   11957                 :            :                      * Failure while streaming. Most likely, we got here
   11958                 :            :                      * because streaming replication was terminated, or
   11959                 :            :                      * promotion was triggered. But we also get here if we
   11960                 :            :                      * find an invalid record in the WAL streamed from master,
   11961                 :            :                      * in which case something is seriously wrong. There's
   11962                 :            :                      * little chance that the problem will just go away, but
   11963                 :            :                      * PANIC is not good for availability either, especially
   11964                 :            :                      * in hot standby mode. So, we treat that the same as
   11965                 :            :                      * disconnection, and retry from archive/pg_wal again. The
   11966                 :            :                      * WAL in the archive should be identical to what was
   11967                 :            :                      * streamed, so it's unlikely that it helps, but one can
   11968                 :            :                      * hope...
   11969                 :            :                      */
   11970                 :            : 
   11971                 :            :                     /*
   11972                 :            :                      * We should be able to move to XLOG_FROM_STREAM
   11973                 :            :                      * only in standby mode.
   11974                 :            :                      */
   11975                 :            :                     Assert(StandbyMode);
   11976                 :            : 
   11977                 :            :                     /*
   11978                 :            :                      * Before we leave XLOG_FROM_STREAM state, make sure that
   11979                 :            :                      * walreceiver is not active, so that it won't overwrite
   11980                 :            :                      * WAL that we restore from archive.
   11981                 :            :                      */
   11982         [ #  # ]:          0 :                     if (WalRcvStreaming())
   11983                 :          0 :                         ShutdownWalRcv();
   11984                 :            : 
   11985                 :            :                     /*
   11986                 :            :                      * Before we sleep, re-scan for possible new timelines if
   11987                 :            :                      * we were requested to recover to the latest timeline.
   11988                 :            :                      */
   11989         [ #  # ]:          0 :                     if (recoveryTargetTimeLineGoal == RECOVERY_TARGET_TIMELINE_LATEST)
   11990                 :            :                     {
   11991         [ #  # ]:          0 :                         if (rescanLatestTimeLine())
   11992                 :            :                         {
   11993                 :          0 :                             currentSource = XLOG_FROM_ARCHIVE;
   11994                 :          0 :                             break;
   11995                 :            :                         }
   11996                 :            :                     }
   11997                 :            : 
   11998                 :            :                     /*
   11999                 :            :                      * XLOG_FROM_STREAM is the last state in our state
   12000                 :            :                      * machine, so we've exhausted all the options for
   12001                 :            :                      * obtaining the requested WAL. We're going to loop back
   12002                 :            :                      * and retry from the archive, but if it hasn't been long
   12003                 :            :                      * since last attempt, sleep wal_retrieve_retry_interval
   12004                 :            :                      * milliseconds to avoid busy-waiting.
   12005                 :            :                      */
   12006                 :          0 :                     now = GetCurrentTimestamp();
   12007         [ #  # ]:          0 :                     if (!TimestampDifferenceExceeds(last_fail_time, now,
   12008                 :            :                                                     wal_retrieve_retry_interval))
   12009                 :            :                     {

   12011                 :            : 
   12012                 :          0 :                         wait_time = wal_retrieve_retry_interval -
   12013                 :          0 :                             TimestampDifferenceMilliseconds(last_fail_time, now);
   12014                 :            : 
   12015                 :          0 :                         (void) WaitLatch(&XLogCtl->recoveryWakeupLatch,
   12016                 :            :                                          WL_LATCH_SET | WL_TIMEOUT |
   12017                 :            :                                          WL_EXIT_ON_PM_DEATH,
   12018                 :            :                                          wait_time,
   12019                 :            :                                          WAIT_EVENT_RECOVERY_WAL_STREAM);
   12020                 :          0 :                         ResetLatch(&XLogCtl->recoveryWakeupLatch);
   12021                 :          0 :                         now = GetCurrentTimestamp();
   12022                 :            :                     }
   12023                 :          0 :                     last_fail_time = now;
   12024                 :          0 :                     currentSource = XLOG_FROM_ARCHIVE;
   12025                 :          0 :                     break;
   12026                 :            : 
   12027                 :            :                 default:
   12028                 :          0 :                     elog(ERROR, "unexpected WAL source %d", currentSource);
   12029                 :            :             }
   12030                 :            :         }
   12031         [ +  - ]:          1 :         else if (currentSource == XLOG_FROM_PG_WAL)
   12032                 :            :         {
   12033                 :            :             /*
   12034                 :            :              * We just successfully read a file in pg_wal. We prefer files in
   12035                 :            :              * the archive over ones in pg_wal, so try the next file again
   12036                 :            :              * from the archive first.
   12037                 :            :              */
   12038         [ -  + ]:          1 :             if (InArchiveRecovery)
   12039                 :          0 :                 currentSource = XLOG_FROM_ARCHIVE;
   12040                 :            :         }
   12041                 :            :

   12081                 :          1 :                     return true;    /* success! */

   12083                 :            :                 /*
   12084                 :            :                  * Nope, not found in archive or pg_wal.

   12087                 :          0 :                 break;
   12088                 :            : 
   12089                 :            :             case XLOG_FROM_STREAM:
   12090                 :            :                 {

   12092                 :            : 
   12093                 :            :                     /*
   12094                 :            :                      * We should be able to move to XLOG_FROM_STREAM
   12095                 :            :                      * only in standby mode.
   12096                 :            :                      */
   12097                 :            :                     Assert(StandbyMode);
   12098                 :            : 
   12099                 :            :                     /*
   12100                 :            :                      * Check if WAL receiver is still active.
   12101                 :            :                      */
   12102         [ #  # ]:          0 :                     if (!WalRcvStreaming())
   12103                 :            :                     {
   12104                 :          0 :                         lastSourceFailed = true;
   12105                 :          0 :                         break;
   12106                 :            :                     }
   12107                 :            : 
   12108                 :            :                     /*
   12109                 :            :                      * Walreceiver is active, so see if new data has arrived.
   12110                 :            :                      *
   12111                 :            :                      * We only advance XLogReceiptTime when we obtain fresh
   12112                 :            :                      * WAL from walreceiver and observe that we had already
   12113                 :            :                      * processed everything before the most recent "chunk"
   12114                 :            :                      * that it flushed to disk.  In steady state where we are
   12115                 :            :                      * keeping up with the incoming data, XLogReceiptTime will
   12116                 :            :                      * be updated on each cycle. When we are behind,
   12117                 :            :                      * XLogReceiptTime will not advance, so the grace time
   12118                 :            :                      * allotted to conflicting queries will decrease.
   12119                 :            :                      */
   12120         [ #  # ]:          0 :                     if (RecPtr < receivedUpto)
   12121                 :          0 :                         havedata = true;
   12122                 :            :                     else
   12123                 :            :                     {
   12124                 :            :                         XLogRecPtr  latestChunkStart;
   12125                 :            : 
   12126                 :          0 :                         receivedUpto = GetWalRcvWriteRecPtr(&latestChunkStart, &receiveTLI);
   12127 [ #  # ][ #  # ]:          0 :                         if (RecPtr < receivedUpto && receiveTLI == curFileTLI)
   12128                 :            :                         {
   12129                 :          0 :                             havedata = true;
   12130         [ #  # ]:          0 :                             if (latestChunkStart <= RecPtr)
   12131                 :            :                             {
   12132                 :          0 :                                 XLogReceiptTime = GetCurrentTimestamp();
   12133                 :          0 :                                 SetCurrentChunkStartTime(XLogReceiptTime);
   12134                 :            :                             }
   12135                 :            :                         }
   12136                 :            :                         else
   12137                 :          0 :                             havedata = false;
   12138                 :            :                     }
   12139         [ #  # ]:          0 :                     if (havedata)
   12140                 :            :                     {
   12141                 :            :                         /*

   12143                 :            :                          * not open already.  Also read the timeline history
   12144                 :            :                          * file if we haven't initialized timeline history
   12145                 :            :                          * yet; it should be streamed over and present in
   12146                 :            :                          * pg_wal by now.  Use XLOG_FROM_STREAM so that source
   12147                 :            :                          * info is set correctly and XLogReceiptTime isn't
   12148                 :            :                          * changed.

   12150         [ #  # ]:          0 :                         if (readFile < 0)
   12151                 :            :                         {

   12154                 :          0 :                             readFile = XLogFileRead(readSegNo, PANIC,
   12155                 :            :                                                     receiveTLI,
   12156                 :            :                                                     XLOG_FROM_STREAM, false);

   12158                 :            :                         }

   12162                 :          0 :                             readSource = XLOG_FROM_STREAM;
   12163                 :          0 :                             XLogReceiptSource = XLOG_FROM_STREAM;
   12164                 :          0 :                             return true;
   12165                 :            :                         }
   12166                 :          0 :                         break;
   12167                 :            :                     }
   12168                 :            : 
   12169                 :            :                     /*
   12170                 :            :                      * Data not here yet. Check for trigger, then wait for
   12171                 :            :                      * walreceiver to wake us up when new WAL arrives.
   12172                 :            :                      */
   12173         [ #  # ]:          0 :                     if (CheckForStandbyTrigger())
   12174                 :            :                     {
   12175                 :            :                         /*
   12176                 :            :                          * Note that we don't "return false" immediately here.
   12177                 :            :                          * After being triggered, we still want to replay all
   12178                 :            :                          * the WAL that was already streamed. It's in pg_wal
   12179                 :            :                          * now, so we just treat this as a failure, and the
   12180                 :            :                          * state machine will move on to replay the streamed
   12181                 :            :                          * WAL from pg_wal, and then recheck the trigger and
   12182                 :            :                          * exit replay.
   12183                 :            :                          */
   12184                 :          0 :                         lastSourceFailed = true;
   12185                 :          0 :                         break;
   12186                 :            :                     }
   12187                 :            : 
   12188                 :            :                     /*
   12189                 :            :                      * Since we have replayed everything we have received so
   12190                 :            :                      * far and are about to start waiting for more WAL, let's
   12191                 :            :                      * tell the upstream server our replay location now so
   12192                 :            :                      * that pg_stat_replication doesn't show stale
   12193                 :            :                      * information.
   12194                 :            :                      */
   12195         [ #  # ]:          0 :                     if (!streaming_reply_sent)
   12196                 :            :                     {
   12197                 :          0 :                         WalRcvForceReply();
   12198                 :          0 :                         streaming_reply_sent = true;
   12199                 :            :                     }
   12200                 :            : 
   12201                 :            :                     /*
   12202                 :            :                      * Wait for more WAL to arrive. Time out after 5 seconds
   12203                 :            :                      * to react to a trigger file promptly and to check if the
   12204                 :            :                      * WAL receiver is still active.

   12225                 :            :     return false;               /* not reached */
   12226                 :            : }
   12227                 :            : 
   12228                 :            : /*
   12229                 :            :  * Determine what log level should be used to report a corrupt WAL record
   12230                 :            :  * in the current WAL page, previously read by XLogPageRead().
   12231                 :            :  *
   12232                 :            :  * 'emode' is the error mode that would be used to report a file-not-found
   12233                 :            :  * or legitimate end-of-WAL situation.   Generally, we use it as-is, but if
   12234                 :            :  * we're retrying the exact same record that we've tried previously, only
   12235                 :            :  * complain the first time to keep the noise down.  However, we only do when
   12236                 :            :  * reading from pg_wal, because we don't expect any invalid records in archive
   12237                 :            :  * or in records streamed from master. Files in the archive should be complete,
   12238                 :            :  * and we should never hit the end of WAL because we stop and wait for more WAL
   12239                 :            :  * to arrive before replaying it.
   12240                 :            :  *
   12241                 :            :  * NOTE: This function remembers the RecPtr value it was last called with,
   12242                 :            :  * to suppress repeated messages about the same record. Only call this when
   12243                 :            :  * you are about to ereport(), or you might cause a later message to be
   12244                 :            :  * erroneously suppressed.
   12245                 :            :  */
   12246                 :            : static int
   12247                 :          0 : emode_for_corrupt_record(int emode, XLogRecPtr RecPtr)
   12248                 :            : {
   12249                 :            :     static XLogRecPtr lastComplaint = 0;
   12250                 :            : 
   12251 [ #  # ][ #  # ]:          0 :     if (readSource == XLOG_FROM_PG_WAL && emode == LOG)
   12252                 :            :     {
   12253         [ #  # ]:          0 :         if (RecPtr == lastComplaint)
   12254                 :          0 :             emode = DEBUG1;
   12255                 :            :         else
   12256                 :          0 :             lastComplaint = RecPtr;
   12257                 :            :     }
   12258                 :          0 :     return emode;
   12259                 :            : }
   12260                 :            : 
   12261                 :            : /*
   12262                 :            :  * Check to see whether the user-specified trigger file exists and whether a
   12263                 :            :  * promote request has arrived.  If either condition holds, return true.
   12264                 :            :  */
   12265                 :            : static bool
   12266                 :          0 : CheckForStandbyTrigger(void)
   12267                 :            : {
   12268                 :            :     struct stat stat_buf;
   12269                 :            :     static bool triggered = false;
   12270                 :            : 
   12271         [ #  # ]:          0 :     if (triggered)
   12272                 :          0 :         return true;
   12273                 :            : 
   12274         [ #  # ]:          0 :     if (IsPromoteTriggered())
   12275                 :            :     {
   12276                 :            :         /*
   12277                 :            :          * In 9.1 and 9.2 the postmaster unlinked the promote file inside the
   12278                 :            :          * signal handler. It now leaves the file in place and lets the
   12279                 :            :          * Startup process do the unlink. This allows Startup to know whether
   12280                 :            :          * it should create a full checkpoint before starting up (fallback
   12281                 :            :          * mode). Fast promotion takes precedence.
   12282                 :            :          */
   12283         [ #  # ]:          0 :         if (stat(PROMOTE_SIGNAL_FILE, &stat_buf) == 0)
   12284                 :            :         {
   12285                 :          0 :             unlink(PROMOTE_SIGNAL_FILE);
   12286                 :          0 :             unlink(FALLBACK_PROMOTE_SIGNAL_FILE);
   12287                 :          0 :             fast_promote = true;
   12288                 :            :         }
   12289         [ #  # ]:          0 :         else if (stat(FALLBACK_PROMOTE_SIGNAL_FILE, &stat_buf) == 0)
   12290                 :            :         {
   12291                 :          0 :             unlink(FALLBACK_PROMOTE_SIGNAL_FILE);
   12292                 :          0 :             fast_promote = false;
   12293                 :            :         }
   12294                 :            : 
   12295         [ #  # ]:          0 :         ereport(LOG, (errmsg("received promote request")));
   12296                 :            : 
   12297                 :          0 :         ResetPromoteTriggered();
   12298                 :          0 :         triggered = true;
   12299                 :          0 :         return true;
   12300                 :            :     }
   12301                 :            : 
   12302 [ #  # ][ #  # ]:          0 :     if (PromoteTriggerFile == NULL || strcmp(PromoteTriggerFile, "") == 0)

   12304                 :            : 
   12305         [ #  # ]:          0 :     if (stat(PromoteTriggerFile, &stat_buf) == 0)
   12306                 :            :     {
   12307         [ #  # ]:          0 :         ereport(LOG,
   12308                 :            :                 (errmsg("promote trigger file found: %s", PromoteTriggerFile)));

   12310                 :          0 :         triggered = true;
   12311                 :          0 :         fast_promote = true;
   12312                 :          0 :         return true;
   12313                 :            :     }
   12314         [ #  # ]:          0 :     else if (errno != ENOENT)
   12315         [ #  # ]:          0 :         ereport(ERROR,
   12316                 :            :                 (errcode_for_file_access(),
   12317                 :            :                  errmsg("could not stat promote trigger file \"%s\": %m",

   12320                 :          0 :     return false;
   12321                 :            : }
   12322                 :            :

   12347                 :            : }
   12348                 :            : 
   12349                 :            : /*
   12350                 :            :  * Wake up startup process to replay newly arrived WAL, or to notice that
   12351                 :            :  * failover has been requested.
   12352                 :            :  */
   12353                 :            : void
   12354                 :          0 : WakeupRecovery(void)
   12355                 :            : {
   12356                 :          0 :     SetLatch(&XLogCtl->recoveryWakeupLatch);
   12357                 :          0 : }
   12358                 :            : 
   12359                 :            : /*
   12360                 :            :  * Update the WalWriterSleeping flag.
